content:
ぜんぶ〔全部〕
〈名〉All; the whole; a complete set:(副詞に用いれば)in all; in full; in its entirety; in toto; en bloc

content.content: これで全部ですか
Is this all?―Are these all?
この本は全部十冊です
The book is complete in ten volumes.
全部で十冊あるのだ
There ought to be ten volumes in all.
本は全部揃っているか
Do the books make a complete set?―Are they complete?
全部揃わない
They are not complete―Some volumes are wanting (to complete the set―の意味)
いま一部あると全部揃う
One more volume will complete the set.
先方の条件を全部容れた
I have accepted the conditions in full―in their entirety―in toto―en bloc.
この本は全部を通じて誤りが一つも無い
There is not a single mistake throughout the whole volume.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は英文学の全部に亙って研究している
He has ranged over English literature―ranged over the length and breadth of English literature.
僕は英語の全部に亙って研究してみようという考えを起こした
I conceived the idea of making an exhaustive study of the English language.
家は全部修繕しなければならぬ
The house wants a thorough overhaul―It must be thoroughly overhauled.

The book is interesting from cover to cover―from title-page to colophon.

content.content: あの先生の講義は千篇一律だ

content:
せんぺんばんか〔千変万化〕
〈名〉Great diversity; infinite variety; kaleidoscopic changes; many phases:(=の) diversified (scenery); kaleidoscopic (changes); ever-changing (world); Protean (metamorphoses); shifting (scenes); versatile (talent):(=する) to be diversified; to present an infinite variety; to undergo kaleidoscopic changes; to have many phases; to be Protean

content.content: 自然は千変万化す
Nature is Protean.
人の性質は千変万化である
Men's natures present an infinite variety.
政局は千変万化極まるところを知らず
The political situation undergoes kaleidoscopic changes.
山の色は千変万化である
The mountain scene is diversified.
彼は千変万化の才を有す
He possesses a versatile talent.
これは千変万化の世である
This is an ever-changing world.
千変万化の世態を見るのは面白い
It is pleasant watch the shifting scenes of life.

1. A specialty; a profession; a line; “shop”:(=の) special; professional; technical

content.content: あの人の専門は何か
What is his specialty?―What is his profession?

His specialty is surgery―He is a surgeon by profession.
あの人は専門は医者だが開業していない

才能を充分に発揮し得る専門を選べ

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

一学科を専門にする

to devote oneself to anything

He devotes himself to English and sports.
あの人は遊び専門だ
He devotes his time to pleasures―He is devoted to pleasures.

to do all one can―do everything in one's power―do one's best―do my utmost
全力を尽して働け
Work with all your might!―Be the whole man at your work!―Give yourself, body and soul, to your work!
仕事に全心全力を注ぐ
to give oneself, body and soul, to one's work―devote the whole man to one's work―devote all one's energies to one's work
君の為に全力を尽そう
I will exert myself to the utmost in your behalf.
一点に全力を集中する
to concentrate one's powers on one's object

この価は先例が無い

君の今度の出来は先例の無い上出来だ

この処置は先例に反する

先例に背く

to break the record―beat the record
今度の成績は先例を破る

犯人は先例によって処分す

Do not be offended at my long silence!

the factors of civilization

The beautiful is a principle in nature.

People of lymphatic temperament has a predisposition to consumption.

content:
そう
〈応答詞〉Yes

content.content: そう(?)
Is that so?―Indeed!―Really!―You don't say so!

content:
そう
〈接尾形容詞〉(=何々らしい)likely (to do something); ready (to do something); in a fair way (to do something):(動詞に訳して)to look, appear, seem (how); to look like (something); to promise, threaten, bid fair (to do something)

content.content: 彼は成功しそうだ
He is likely to succeed―He is in a fair way to succeed―He bids fair to succeed.
僕は失敗しそうだ
I am likely to fail―in danger of failing.
そうありそうなことだ
That is very likely―That may well be―It is no wonder that it should be so―No wonder!
それはありそうなことだ
That is very likely to happen.
ありそうな話だ
It is a likely story.
それはありそうなことだと思う
I think it likely.
彼は縁談に反対したがまたありそうなことだ
He opposed the match, and (it is) no wonder (that he should have done so).
君は丈夫そうだ
You look strong.
利口そうな子だ
The child looks bright.
あの犬は食いつきそうだ
The dog looks like biting―looks snappish.
この魚は新しそうだ
The fish looks fresh.
あの人は正直そうだ
He seems to be honest.
こりゃ面白そうな本だ
The book looks interesting.
有りそうで無いものは金
People will appear to be rich.
無さそうで有るものは借金
People will appear to be out of debt.
君がするところを見るとやさしそうだ
To see you do it, one would think it easy.
誰にでもできそうだ
One would think any one could do it.
彼女は今にも泣き出しそうだ
She is ready to cry.
彼は今にも倒れそうだ
He is ready to drop.
船は今にも沈みそうだ
She is ready to sink.
降りそうだ
It looks like rain.
晴れそうだ
It looks like clearing.
好い天気になりそうだ
The weather promises to be fine.
今にも降り出しそうだ
It threatens to rain every moment.
今にも降り出しそうな空
a threatening sky
今日は吹きそうだ
It threatens to blow today.
晴れそうな模様は無い
There is no appearance of the weather clearing―There is no sign of the weather clearing.
雨が止みそうも無い
There is no sign of the rain stopping.
暴風雨が来そうだ
There are signs of a coming storm.
彼は来そうな様子が無い
There is no sign of his coming.
彼はなかなか金を返しそうも無い
He seems in no hurry to pay me.
彼は今の地位に満足しているからなかなか止めそうもない
He is contented with his present position, and seems in no hurry to leave.
この事業は多大の利益が有りそうだ
The business promises large returns.
今度の計画はうまくいきそうだ
The project promises to be a success―bids fair to be a success.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: ずいぶん長く降ったから天気になりそうなものだ
The weather ought to be fine after such a long rain.
今日あたりは来そうなものだ
He ought to come today.
誰か来そうなものだ
Some one ought to come.
金を貸してくれても好さそうなものだ
You might lend me the money.
暇乞いくらいには来ても好かりそうなものだ
He might at least have come to say good-bye.
好さそうな男だ
He is a good sort of a fellow―a decent sort of a chap.
いかにも彼の言いそうなことだ
It is just like him to say so―The remark is characteristic of the man.
あの生意気の言いそうなことだ
That is just like his impertinence.
あの男のしそうなことだ
It is just like him (to do so)―The action is characteristic of the man.
彼はさもうまそうに食う
He eats with evident relish.
うまそうなご馳走
a tempting dish―an appetizing dish
君は面白そうに読んでいる
Your are reading with evident interest.
彼はさも満足そうに微笑した
He smiled with evident satisfaction.
さも嬉しそうだ
He looks so glad.
嬉しそうな顔をして入ってきた
He came in with a glad countenance.
さも嬉しそうに眺めている
He gloats over the sight.
悲しそうなふうをして窓に立っていた
He was standing at the window with a sad air.
子どもが欲しそうにして店の品を眺めていた
The child was looking at the goods displayed with longing eyes.
彼は吹けば倒れそうだ
You might knock him down with a feather.
(満堂水を打ったようで)針一本落ちても聞こえそうだ
A pin might be heard to drop.

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=何々なる由)people say; they say; it is said; it is reported; I am told; I hear; I understand

content.content: 彼は発狂したそうだ
People say he is mad―He is said to be mad―He is reported to be mad.
校長が辞職するそうだ
I hear that the principal is going to resign―The principal is going to resign, I hear―I understand.
彼はたいそう金持ちなそうだ
He is said to be very rich.
彼は病気なそうだ
He is said to be ill―reported to be sick.
そうなそうです
So I hear―So I understand.
あの人はそう言ったそうだ
He is credited with the saying.

content:
そう〔沿う〕
〈他動〉To go along (the track); to lie along (the line); to run along (the bank); to skirt (the coast, etc.)

content.content: 路は土手に沿っている
The path runs along the bank.
町はずれに沿って鉄道がある
A railway skirts the town.

content:
そう〔左様〕
〈副〉So; so much; as much

content.content: そうです(仰せの通り)
So it is―Such is the case―You are right―(相手の言葉次第で)―So I am―So you are―So he is.
僕もそうです
So am I―The same is the case with me.
君もやはりそうだ
So are you―The same is the case with you.
俺が馬鹿ならお前もそうだ
If I am a fool, so are you―you are another.
あの男はいつもそうだ
That is always the case with that man.
そうですか
Is that so?―Is that the case?―(相手の言葉次第で)―Am I?―Are you?―Is he?
本当にそうか(冗談じゃないか)
Really!―Indeed!―You don't say so!―Are you in earnest?
本当にそうです(冗談じゃない)
I mean what I say.
そうでない
It is not so―It is otherwise―That is not the case―(相手の言葉次第で)―No, I am not―No, you are not―No, he is not.
そうだとも
Indeed, it is―Yes, indeed!
そうでないとも
Indeed, it is not―No, indeed!
そうともさ
So it is, to be sure.
そうでしょう
I think so―(好いことなら)―I hope so―(悪いことなら)―I fear so―I am afraid so.
そうでないでしょう
I think not―(悪いことを打消せば)―I hope not―(好いことを打消せば)―I fear not―I am afraid not.
そうでしょう(?)
Isn't that so?―(自分の前に言ったこと次第で)―am I not?―are you not?―is it not?
そうでしょうって、そうだろうとも
I shouldn't be surprised (if it were so)―That may well be.
ああそうだ、彼に違いない
Yes, it must be he.
そうそう、すっかり忘れておった
Yes, I had forgotten all about it.
もしそうなら金を出してもよい
If so,―If that is the case,―In that case,―Then,―I am willing to give something.
もしそうでなけりゃ金を出すのはいやだ
If not so,―Otherwise,―I will not give the money.
そうならそうでよし
Be it so!
(病人ですか)そうさね、そうですね、まあ好い方でしょうね
Well, he is better, I should think.
そうだろうと思った
I thought so―I thought as much.
そうでなかろうと思う
I do not think so―I think otherwise.
そうしか思われん
I can not but think so―It must be so.
そうならよいが
I wish it were so.
そうでなけりゃよいが
I wish it would not be so―I wish it would be otherwise.
彼は無事でいるだろう、別にそうでないようなことも聞かないから
He must be well, for I hear nothing to the contrary.
君はなにかそうでないようなことを知っているのか
Do you know anything to the contrary?
それもそうだ
That's true―There is something in that.
そりゃーそうさ
There is no doubt about it.
それはそうと君はなぜ学校を止めたかね
By the bye, why have you quitted teaching?
それはそうとしていま一つ問題がある
Apart from that,―Setting apart that matter,―there is still another consideration.
いかにもそうありそうなことだ
That is very likely―That may well be―It is no wonder that it should be so―No wonder!
誰がそう言ったか
Who said so?―Who is responsible for the statement?
彼はそう言うのを聞きました
I have heard him say so.
そう言って下さるのはあなたばかり
It is kind of you to say so.
彼はそうだと言った
He said it was so―(どこまでもそうだと主張した)―He asserted it to be so―asserted the fact―(なるほどそうだと言った)―He admitted the fact.
彼はそうでないと言った
He said it was not so―denied it to be so―denied the fact.
そう言えば僕だって同じことだ
I am the same, for that matter.
そうばかりは言えぬ
It is not always so―It may or may not be so―That depends on circumstances.
そうかと言って毎日来られては困る
It would, however, be awkward to have him come every day.
そう申してはなんですがあなたのが一番です
If I might give an opinion, I should say yours were the best of all―Yours is under favour, the best of all.→『そういう』
そうするのがよい
You will do well to do so―You had better do so.
そうするよりほかは無い
I can not but do so―I can not choose but do so―I have no choice but to do so―There is nothing for it but to do so―I must do so.
もっと勉強なさいそうしないと落第するよ
Work harder, or―else―or else―otherwise―you will fail.
そうすると今度は僕の番かね
Then it is my turn next, is it?
そうすれば君は試験を受けることは無いのだ
Then you would not have to be examined.
おいでの節はお知らせ下さいそうすれば宅に居るようにしますから
Let me know when you are coming, so that I may be at home.
(百円)そうは出ない
It did not cost so much―I did not give so much.
(千円になる)そうなるかね
Do you make it so much?
どうしてそうなったかね
How do you make it so much?
そうも取れる
It may be interpreted in that way.
Plato は霊魂は不滅だと言ったが僕もそう信ずる
I believe with Plato that the soul is immortal.
そう好くはないね
It is not very good(not so good―とは言わず).
そうはいかん
Impossible!
そうはいくまい
That must be impossible.
どっこい、そうはいかぬ(そううまくは鳥賊の睾丸)
Not so fast!―There are two words to that bargain.
世の中はそうしたものだ
Such is the way of the world.
田舎だってそうばかにしたものじゃない
The country is not to be despised.

1. (=かさなり)a layer:(地の層)a stratum(複数―strata):(薄い層)a seam:(岩石の層)a formation:(石炭の層)a bed:(空中、海中などの層)a region:(煉瓦の層)a course

1. (=人相)physiognomy

content.content: 彼は剣難の相がある

死相がある

君は Napoleon の相がある

content.content: 総体

総益

巡査の総出

総辞職

そう〔草〕

content:
そう〔添う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=付き添う)to accompany, attend upon (anything)

content.content: 身に添わぬ
to be out of keeping with one's character
そんな地位は身に添わぬ
The position is too good for me.
嬉しくて(悲しくて)魂も身に添わなかった
I was beside myself with joy (sorrow).

content: 2. (=連れ添う)to become man and wife; to marry, be married to (a man or a woman); to match with, be matched with (a man or a woman); to mate with, be mated with (a man or a woman); to be united with (a man or a woman)

content.content: 思って添われぬことはない
I will marry the man I love.
いくら思っても添われない
I can not marry the man I love.
思うに添わで思わぬに添う
Love has nothing to do with marriage.
お前達を添わしてやる
I will unite you two―match you two―make you man and wife.
あんな人はいつまで添っていても末の見込みが無い
I shall have no chance of rising in the world if I remain united with such a man.
馬には乗って見よ人には添ってみよ
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”

content:
そう〔副う〕
〈他動〉To meet (one's wishes); to fulfil (one's hopes); to justify (one's confidence); to come up to (one's expectations); to be equal to (one's desire)

content.content: これならお望みに副うだろうと思う
I hope this article will meet your wishes.
どうかあなたの所期に副うようにしたいものです
I wish I could meet your expectations―fulfil your expectations―come up to your expectations.
結果は期待に副わぬ
The result does not come up to my expectations―The result falls short of my expectations.
実は名に副わぬ
The reality falls short of the fame.
ご信任に副わんことを期す
I hope I shall justify your confidence in me.
運は慾望に副うものでない
Fortune is never equal to our desires.

content:

content.content: 象は長命だ

象は高齢に達する

女の髪は大象をもつなぐ

content:

〈名〉
1. Difference; disagreement; discrepancy; disparity; variance:(=する)to differ (from each other) ; to be different (from each other) ; to disagree(with each other) ; to be at variance (with each other)

content.content: 相似の点と相違の点
points of agreement and difference
両者間に非常な相違がある
There is a wide difference between the two.
意見の相違はしかたがない
There will be difference of opinion―We must make allowances for difference of opinion.
二人の話には甚だ相違するところがある

夫婦にしては年齢の相違が甚だしい

記事は事実と相違している

はばかりながら御説はちと事実と相違しております
With all respect for your opinion, your statement is not in strict accord with the truth.
ここが即ち新式と旧式との相違の点である
This is the point where the new style differs from the old―departs from the old.
見ると聞くとは大した相違

案に相違して彼は成功した
Contrary to expectation, he has succeeded.
右の通り相違御座無く候
I affirm the above to be true in every particular―(に相当するは)―E. & O. E.―(=Errors and Omissions Excepted―誤謬脱漏この限りにあらず).

content:
そうおう〔相応〕
〈形〉
1. Due (reward) ; fair, reasonable (price) ; decent (appearance) ; respectable (house) ; competent (fortune) ; tolerable (performance) ; passable (ability) ; fit, proper (person) ; suitable (position, etc.)

content.content: 相応な報酬をする
He shall have a due reward―I will give him his due.
相応の礼をもって彼を遇した
We treated him with due honour―did him due honour.
相応な価をもって買おう
I will give you a fair price―a reasonable price―for it.
写真は相応に撮れている
The photograph is fairly taken.
彼は相応な身形{みなり}をしている
He is decently dressed―He makes a decent appearance.
相応に暮らしている
He is in decent circumstances―in respectable circumstances―He makes a decent living―“cracks a tidy crust.”
相応な家に住んでいる
He lives in a decent house―a respectable house.
彼は相応に信用のある(小売)商人だ
He is a respectable tradesman.
相応な資産がある
He has a competent fortune―a competence.
相応な身代をこしらえる
to acquire a competence
相応な手際だ
It is a decent performance―a respectable performance―a tolerable performance―a passable performance.
彼は相応に学力がある
He has decent ability―respectable ability―tolerable ability―passable ability.
彼は相応に英語を話す
He speaks English tolerably well―passably well―fairly well.
相応な人があったらお知らせ下さい
If you hear of a fit and proper person, please let me know.
相応な地位があったらお世話しよう
If I come across a suitable position, I will procure it for you.
娘を相応なところへ縁づけたいと思う
I wish to marry my daughter into a suitable family.
娘どもは相応なところへ縁づいている
The daughters are all married into respectable families.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 誰でも相応に幸福は有るものだ
Everybody has his share of happiness.
彼も相応に己惚が有る
He has his (share of) vanity.
(無くて七癖で)彼も相応に癖が有る
He has his faults.

content: 2. (=何に相応な)becoming (a young man) ; befitting (one's station) ; due to (one's rank) ; suited to (a person) ; proportionate to (its size) ; proper for (a gentleman) ; worthy of (a gentleman) :(=する) to become (a young man) ; to befit (one's station) ; to be due to (one's rank) ; to be suited to (a person) ; to be proportionate to (its size) ; to be proper for (a gentleman) ; to be worthy of (a gentleman)

content.content: 謙遜は青年に相応だ
Modesty becomes a young man―Modesty is becoming in a young man.
身分相応
befitting one's station
それが身分相応だ
That befits your station.
彼は身分相応な教育を受けている
He has had an education befitting his station.
紳士に相応な教育を受けている
He has had an education proper for a gentleman―worthy of a gentleman.
彼は身分相応に暮らしている
He lives in a style befitting his means―lives within his means.
身分相応に暮らせ
Conform yourself to your fortunes―“Cut your coat according to your cloth.”
身分に相応しないぜいたくをする
to live above one's means
おのおの身分相応に寄付をした
Each gave according to his means―in proportion to his wealth.
彼の地位に相応な礼をもって彼を遇した
We did him the honour due to his rank―We did him due honour.
君に相応な地位があったらお世話しよう
If I come across a position suited to you, I will procure it for you.
君に相応な細君があったら貰い給え
If you find a lady suited to you, marry her.
身体の大きさに相応して力が有る
His strength is proportionate to his size―He is strong in proportion to his size―He is strong in proportion as he is large―He is as strong as he is large.
支出が収入に相応しない
The expenses are out of all proportion to the receipts.

content.content: 今日でちょうど創業五周年である
It is five years to a day today since the enterprise was started―the company was established.

It is more difficult to maintain than to initiate―It is easy to set things a going, but hard to keep them going.

He is made not for creation but for maintenance―He is not a man of genius, but a man of character.
しかしなにを言っても創業は困難だ
After all, it is a difficult thing to get under way.

〈名〉A premature scheme:(=なる) premature; hasty; rash; precipitate

content.content: やってもみないうちから諦めをつけるのは早計だ
It is premature to abandon hope before you have tried―(英国ふうに言うと)―It will be time enough to give up hope when you have tried and failed.
学者だから常識が無いときめるのは早計だ
It is a premature judgment―a hasty conclusion―to think that, because a man is a scholar, he must be wanting in common sense.
そう思うのは大早計だ
You must not jump to that conclusion.
成功しもしないうちから成功したつもりになるのは大早計だ
It is rash to anticipate success.
早計に失する
to be rash―hasty―precipitate
早計に失するなかれ
Don't be rash!―Don't be hasty!―Don't “count your chickens before they are hatched”―Don't “sell the calf in the cow's belly.”

content.content: 総計いくらになるか

The debts total―amount to―come to―foot up to―10,000 yen.

The total number is 500―There are 500 in all―There are 500 all told.

The total amount of the revenue has reached 1,500,000,000 yen―The revenue now totals 1,500,000,000 yen.

〈名〉Cleaning; sweeping; scrubbing; scavengery:(=する) to clean (a house) ; to sweep (a room) ; to scrub (the floor) ; to scavenge (the streets)

content.content: 座敷を掃除してくれ
Please clean (up) my room!―sweep (up) my room!―do my room!
いま掃除したばかりの座敷をまた散らしたね
You have again littered the room I had only just cleaned up.
庭を掃除さして下さい
Please have the garden cleaned!
庭は掃除が行届いているか
Is the garden well kept?
掃除が行届かない
It is ill kept.
ご到着前に家を掃除さしておきます
I shall have the house cleaned previous to your arrival.
家の掃除は塵一つ無いように行き届いている
The house is kept with the utmost cleanliness.
うちの男にお靴を掃除さしておきます
I shall have my man clean your shoes.
市街を掃除する
to scavenge the streets―sweep the crossing
市街掃除人
a scavenger―a street orderly―a crossing-sweeper
今日は大掃除だ
We have a house-cleaning―a general house-cleaning―today.
拭き掃除

掃除屋(肥取り)

He is a statesman of high principles.

Most politicians have no principles―They are unprincipled.

content:
そうじゅう〔操縦〕
〈名〉Management; manipulation; manoeuvre; operation; control:(=する) to manage (a boat) ; to manipulate (men) ; to handle (an oar) ; to manoeuvre (a fleet) ; to work (a ship) ; to serve (a gun) ; to operate (a machine) ; to control (a motor-car) ; to pilot (an aeroplane)

content.content: 機械を操縦する
to work a machine―(米国にては)―operate a machine
船を操縦する
to work a ship―navigate a ship―manage a boat
この船を操縦するに何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
操縦しやすい船、操縦しにくい船
a manageable ship―an unmanageable ship
船が操縦の自由を失う
A ship is disabled.
砲を操縦する
to work a gun―serve a gun
砲の操縦よろしきを得
The guns are well served.
軍隊を操縦する
to manoeuvre troops
艦隊を操縦する
to manoeuvre a fleet
飛行機を操縦する
to pilot an aeroplane―control an aeroplane―handle an aeroplane―navigate an aeroplane
機械が操縦し難くなる
A machine becomes unmanageable―One loses control of the machine.
飛行機の操縦者
a pilot
飛行機の操縦機
a controlling gear
時計の操縦機
an escapement
人を操縦する
to manage people―manoeuvre people―manipulate people―handle people
彼は人を上手に操縦する
He manages people with skill―manoeuvres people with tact.
彼は部下の操縦がうまい
He has tact in managing his subordinates.
西洋では妻が夫を操縦する、日本では妻が夫に操縦される
The foreign wife manages her husband; the Japanese wife is managed by her husband.
黒幕となって人を操縦する
to pull the wires―pull the strings
人の操縦者
a wire-puller
議会の党員を操縦する
to whip the followers in or together
議会の党員操縦者
a whipper

日本人は概して早熟早老だ
Japanese, as a rule, grow and decay early.

content.content: 室内は額を掛けて装飾してある
The room is ornamented with paintings.

楽隊が楽を奏する

功を奏す
to take effect―bear fruit―be effectual―be successful―succeed―(武器なら)―do execution―tell
薬が功を奏した
The medicine has taken effect―had effect on the patient.
試みが功を奏した
The attempt was effectual―successful.

勉強が功を奏した

content:

content.content: 明朝早々出発致します
I start bright and early tomorrow morning.
来月早々参ります
I am going early next month―in the beginning of next month.
彼は卒業早々実業界に入った
He went into business as soon as he graduated―immediately on his graduation.
新夫婦は新婚早々海外へ向かいます

二人は新年早々結婚する

新年早々借金取りはひどい
It is hard that I should be dunned for a debt, of all days in the year, on New Year's day.
新年早々吉事がある
The New Year begins auspiciously.
新年早々凶事がある

早々出発する

彼は早々都を出発した
He went packing out of town.
話も早々にして帰って来た

1. Imagination; fancy; conception; an idea; a creation of the brain; a coinage of the brain:(=する) to imagine; to fancy; to conceive; to form a conception of (anything); to form an idea of (anything); to picture to oneself, figure to oneself, image to oneself:(=の) imaginary; fancied

content.content: 僕の想像通りであった

後は想像に任せる
You may imagine the rest―The rest may be imagined.
実際は想像に反する
The reality is contrary to what one imagines.
実際は想像と大違いだ

完全な人を想像する(夢に周公を見る)
to conceive a perfect man
これに勝るものは想像もできぬ
A better is not to be conceived―A better is inconceivable―It is the best conceivable.
これが想像し得べき限りだ
This is the greatest conceivable.
その美は想像も及ばぬ
The beauty is beyond imagination―The beauty baffles imagination―defies imagination―beggars imagination.
その場を実見しなけりゃ想像もつかぬ

想像したばかりでもぞっとする

content.content: 国内の敵を掃蕩する
to sweep the enemy from the country―drive the enemy out of the country―clear the country of the enemy―clear the country
海上の敵を掃蕩する
to clear the seas of the enemy―sweep the enemy from the seas―sweep the seas

content:
そうとう〔相当〕
〈形〉
1. Due (reward); deserved, merited (praise); condign (punishment); fair, reasonable (price); fit, proper (person); suitable (position); decent (living); respectable (house); competent (fortune); tolerable (performance); passable (ability); sufficient (reason, etc.)

content.content: 相当の報酬をする
He shall have a due reward―I will give him his due.
相当の礼をもって彼を遇した
We treated him with due honour―did him due honour.
相当の手続きを履む
to go through due formalities
犯人は相当の処分を受けた
The culprit was deservedly dealt with.
恐れ入りました、相当のご処分を願います
I throw myself upon your mercy. Deal with me as you think fit!
それが相当の罰じゃわい(好い気味だ)
You richly deserve it―Serve you right!―It is a condign punishment.
至極相当の待遇だ
The terms are fair.
相当の待遇できてくれまいか
Will you accept an appointment on fair terms?
相当な価で買おう
I will give you a fair price―a reasonable price―for it.
相当な人物があったらお知らせ下さい
If you hear of a fit and proper person, you will please let me know.
相当な地位があったらお世話しよう
If I come across a suitable position, I will procure it for you.
彼は相当な地位を得た
He has obtained a suitable position―(社会になら)―found his place in society.
病人に相当の手当てをするように
See that the sick are properly cared for!
彼は相当な身形{みなり}をしている
He is decently dressed.
相当に暮らしている
He is in decent circumstances―in respectable circumstances―He makes a decent living.
相当な家に住んでいる
He lives in a respectable house.
相当な資産がある
He has a competent fortune―a competence.
相当な身代をこしらえる
to acquire a competence
相当な金を握ったら国へ帰ろうと思う
I mean to go home when I have a decent sum in my possession.
相当な手段だ
It is a decent performance―a respectable performance―a tolerable performance―a passable performance.
相当の学力が有る
He has decent ability―respectable ability―tolerable ability―passable ability.
彼は相当に英語を話す
He speaks English tolerably well―passably well―fairly well.
相当の理由無く解雇することはできぬ
I can not dismiss him without sufficient reason.

content: 2. (=何に相当の)becoming (a youth); befitting (one's station); due to (one's rank); suited to (a person); proportionate to (its size); equivalent to (a yen); corresponding to (a prince); ranking with (a colonel); proper for (a gentleman); worthy of (a gentleman):(=する) to become (a youth); to befit (one's station); to correspond to (a prince); to rank with (a colonel); to be due to (one's rank); to be suited to (a person); to be proportionate to (its size); to be equal to (ten); to be equivalent to (a yen); to be proper for (a gentleman); to be worthy of (a gentleman)

content.content: 謙遜は青年に相当する
Modesty becomes a young man―Modesty is becoming in a young man.
身分相当
befitting one's station
それが身分に相当だ
That befits your station.
彼は身分に相当な暮らしをしている
He lives in a style befitting his status.
彼は身分に相当の教育がある
He has had an education befitting his status.
紳士に相当の教育がある
He has had an education proper for a gentleman―worthy of a gentleman.
おのおの身分に相当の寄付をした
Each gave according to his means―in proportion to his wealth.
彼の地位に相当の礼をもって遇した
We treated him with the honour due to his rank―did him the honour due to his rank―did him due honour.
地位に相当の威厳を保っている
He maintains a dignity due to his social position.
君に相当の地位があったらお世話しよう
If I come across a position suited to you, I will procure it for you.
君に相当の細君があったら貰い給え
If you find a lady suited to you, marry her.
身体の大きさに相当した力が有る
His strength is proportionate to his size―He is strong in proportion to his size―He is strong in proportion as he is large.
一ドルは二円に相当する
A dollar is equivalent to two yen―A dollar corresponds to two yen.
沈黙は偽りに相当する場合がある
Silence is sometimes equivalent to a lie.
沈黙は承諾に相当する
“Silence gives consent.”
英国の“duke”は我が公爵に相当する
The English duke corresponds to the Japanese prince.
英語には「流石」に相当する言葉が無い
The English language has no word corresponding to “sasuga”―no equivalent for “sasuga”.
中学卒業もしくはこれに相当する学歴を有する者に限る
Those only are admitted who have completed the middle school course or gone through a similar course of study.
彼は給料に相当する働きがある
He is earning his salary―worth his salt.
給料に相当する働きが無い(穀つぶしだ)
He is not worth his salt.
大佐相当官
an officer ranking with a colonel

to make a disturbance―create a disturbance―raise a disturbance―cause a disturbance―stir up troubles
騒動が起こる
Troubles arise.
国内に騒動が起こっている
The country is agitated―in commotion.
ひと騒動持上がりそうだ

大騒動が持ち上がるところであった

騒動が静まった
The disturbance has settled down―The tumult has subsided.

School troubles have arisen.
お家騒動

松前騒動

content:
そうば〔相場〕
〈名〉
1. (=市価)the price; the market-price; the current price; the ruling price; (the state of) the market; a rate; a figure; a quotation

content.content: 相場を立てる
to set the prices―regulate the market
相場が立つ
The prices rule.
品物は時の相場で頂戴します
I will buy the goods at the current price.
その相場では取引しかねます
I can not deal with you at that price―at that rate―at that figure.
米は一升五十銭の相場だ
Rice stands at 50 sen a sho―Rice is quoted at 50 sen a sho.
いくらと物品の相場を付ける
to quote commodities at so much
この株は百五十円の相場だ
These shares are quoted at 150 yen.
相場付け
quotations
取引所相場
exchange quotations
相場が上がる
to rise in price―advance in price
相場が下がる
to fall in price―decline n price
相場の高下がある
The market rises and falls―The prices fluctuate.
この株は相場が(額面以上に)上がっている
These shares are at a premium.
(額面以下に)相場が下がっている
They are at a discount.
相場が概して上がっている、概して下がっている
The prices rule high―The prices rule low.
相場が暴騰する
The prices jump―The prices soar.
相場の暴騰
a jump
相場が暴落する
The prices slump.
相場の暴落
a slump
相場の変動が烈しい
The prices are subject to violent fluctuations.
相場が奔騰暴落する
The prices jump and slump―The prices fluctuate violently―The prices run up and down the gamut.
株は相場が狂いやすい
The stocks fluctuate in price.
狂い易い相場
a sensitive market
大戦乱で万事の相場が狂った
The Great War has dislocated the world.
相場を狂わす
to affect the price―(人為的なら)―rig the market
開戦の噂で株の相場が狂う
The rumour of war affects the stock market.
成金が旅館や料理屋の相場を狂わした
The upstart millionaires have spoiled the hotels and restaurants.

content.content: 相場をやる
to speculate (in rice or stocks)
米相場
speculation in rice
彼は米相場をやる
He speculates in rice―gambles in rice.
株式相場をやる
He speculates in stocks―gambles in stocks.
相場に手を出す
to dabble in speculation
米相場に手を出す
to dabble in rice
なんだって柄にも無い相場などに手を出したのか
What put it in your head to dabble in speculation, which is quite out of keeping with your character?
相場を当てる
to make a hit in speculation
彼は相場で損をした(ひどくやられた)
He was hard hit in speculation.
相場で身代をすってしまった
He is ruined by speculation.
相場師
a speculator―(株式なら)―a stock-jobber

content: 4. (=人の評判、価値)opinion; public estimation

content.content: あの男は相場を上げた、相場を下げた
He has risen in the public estimation―fallen ［sunk］ in the public estimation.
近頃学士の相場が下がった
The University men have fallen in the public estimation.
そんなことをすると人間の相場が下がるぞ
Such conduct will lower ［sink］ you in the public estimation.
彼は今度のことで相場を上げた
The late affair has raised him in the public estimation.
人はうっちゃっておくと自然に世間の相場がきまる
Let a man alone, and he will find his own level in society.
人の相場をきめる
to form an estimate of a man―form an opinion of a man―size up a man
あの人は支那通と相場がきまっている
He is acknowledged as an authority on Chinese affairs.
そんなことをすると不正な人間と相場をきめられてしまうぞ
Such actions will stamp you as dishonest.

content:

They adore him―idolize him―make an idol of him―worship his shadow as he passes―worship the ground he stands on―wear him in their heart of hearts.
彼は世間から非常に崇拝されている
He is universally adored―universally idolized―He is an idol of the people.

〈名〉Restraint; restriction; fetters; shackles:(=する) to restrain; to restrict; to bind; to tie; to curb; to fetter; to shackle

content.content: 人を束縛する
to put restraint on a man―place a man under restraint

to restrain one's liberty―restrict one's freedom―curb one's freedom―fetter one's freedom―tie one's hands
兵士は自由を束縛されている
The soldiers have their freedom restricted.
制限を設けて人を束縛する

制限をもって束縛されている
I am laid under restrictions.
約束をさして人を束縛する
to bind one by a promise
約束で束縛されている
I am bound by a promise.
条件を設けて人を束縛する
to tie down a man to conditions
条件をもって束縛されている
I am tied down to conditions.
因襲の束縛
the shackles of convention
人を束縛せぬ
to allow one freedom―leave one a free hand
あの学校では生徒を束縛する
The school allows no freedom to the students.
束縛を脱する
to free oneself from restraint―break through restraint―shake off the yoke―shake oneself free from the yoke―slip the leash

The advocates of universal suffrage claim that all social evils can be cured by its introduction.

to take the enemy in the flank―flank the enemy

側面攻撃
a flank attack―a flanking attack

a flanking fire―a raking fire―an enfilade

to enfilade the enemy―rake the enemy

to turn the enemy's flank

to outflank the enemy

a side-view―a side-elevation―a lateral elevation
側面観
a side-view
それがキリスト教の側面観である
This is a side-view of Christianity.

〈名〉(陸地のは)survey; surveying:(海の深さのは)sounding:(一般のは)mensuration:(=する) to survey (land) ; to sound (the sea) ; to measure (anything)

content.content: 土地を測量する
to survey land
今敷地を測量している
They are making a survey of the site.
敷地を測量して貰った
I have had the site surveyed―had a survey made of the site.
陸地測量(術)
land-surveying
測量技術
a surveyor
測量機械
surveying instruments

a surveying-ship
測量図
a survey-map

to sound the sea―take sounding―heave the lead
太平洋はまだ測量した人が無い
The Pacific Ocean has never been sounded.
三角測量
triangulation

content:
そくりょく〔速力〕
〈名〉Speed; velocity; rate

content.content: 光線は一秒間に186,000マイルの速力を有す
Light has a velocity of 186,000 miles a second―Light travels at the rate of 186,000 miles a second.
汽車は一時間四十マイルの速力で走る
The trains run at the rate of 40 miles an hour.
この汽船は二十ノットの速力が出る
This steamer has a speed of 20 knots―she is good for 20 knots.
二十ノットの速力を出す
to put forth a speed of 20 knots―develop a speed of 20 knots
この船は二十ノットの速力を出している
We are doing 20 knots.
速力三十ノットの巡洋艦が必要になった
We must now have cruisers of 30 knots speed.
この船は速力が早い
This ship is fast―This is a fast ship―She has a high speed.
この船は速力が遅い
This ship is slow―This is a slow ship―She has a low speed.
速力を増す、速力を加える、速力を早める
to put on speed
速力を減ずる、速力を緩める
to lessen speed―reduce speed―slacken speed―slow down―(汽車なら)―slack up
速力が早くなる
(汽船なら)A steamer gathers speed―(帆船なら)―A ship gathers way―(風なら)―The wind gains in velocity
艦隊が全速力で進んだ
The squadron advanced (at) full speed.
騎兵が全速力で進んだ
The cavalry advanced (at) full gallop.
一人の男が全速力で走って来た
A man came running at the top of his speed.
全速力を出す
to put forth full speed―develop full speed
軍艦は経済速力で航海する
A warship cruises at economical speed.
この船は通常速力で走っている
We are running at normal speed.
汽船は緩慢な速力で走っておった
The ship was under easy steam.
速力制限
the speed-limit
制限速力
regulation speed
自動車は制限速力で走る
The motor-cars run at regulation speed.
速力試験
a speed trial

content.content: ご足労を煩したい
I beg you will come.
明日私宅までご足労を煩したい
You will please call at my place tomorrow.
遠方ご足労をかけて済みません
I am sorry to have put you to the trouble of coming all the way―Thank you for coming so far!

He is a good shot―a capital shot.
狙撃の名人だ
He is a crack shot―a dead shot.
大将は敵に狙撃された

a sharpshooter―a sniper

1. To slip; to splinter

content:
そこ〔其処〕
〈名〉That place:(=に) in that place; there:(=へ) there:(古文体にては)thither:(=から) from there:(古文体にては) thence; from thence:(=まで) so far:(=で)upon that ; thereupon

content.content: そこにおれ
Stay there!
じきそこだ
It is only a step from here.
そこ放せ
Let go your hold!
そこどけ
Get out of my way!
商売人そこどけという手際だ
His performance would put the professional to the blush.
ものの二時間も漕いだか、そこへ暴風雨がやって来た
We had been pulling a matter of two hours, when a storm came on.
そこまでは尋ねなかった
I did not inquire so far.
そこまでは信用してくれない
He does not trust me so far.
そこまでいっしょに行こう
I will go a little way with you.

content: 〈代名詞〉That

content.content: そこだ
That's the point.
しかしそこが問題だ
But that's the question.
そこが彼の長所だ
That is his forte.
そこが彼の弱点だ
That is his weak point.
そこが身上だ
That's the beauty of it.
そこが値打だ
Therein lies its merit.
そこが武士だ
That is what makes a samurai what he is.
そこが聞きたいのだ
That is what I want to know.
そこがわからないのだ
That is what I do not comprehend―That is above my comprehension―That is a mystery to me.
そこまでは思い及ばなかった
I did not think so far as that.
そこはとんと思いつかなかった
I never thought of that.
そこが困難なところだ
That is where the shoe pinches.
そこへいくと専門家は違う
That is where the professional man comes in.
そこへいくと彼は偉い
That is what makes him a great man.
そこどころの騒ぎじゃない
That is a minor matter.
そこは抜かりは無いさ
I know what I am about―I understand my business.

content:
そこ〔底〕
〈名〉
1. The bottom (of the sea, a river, a box, a tub, or a ship) ; the bed (of a river or a pond) ; the floor (of the sea or a cave) ; the sole (of a shoe) ; the depths (of the sea) ; the recesses (of the heart) ; the bowels, the entrails (of the earth)

content.content: 海の底へ沈む
to go to the bottom―sink into the depths of the sea
足が底に届く
to touch bottom―touch ground
金銀は地の底から掘る
Gold and silver are dug out of the bowels of the earth.
たとい火の中水の底
I would go through fire and water for your sake.
底無き深み
bottomless depths―fathomless depths
(桶などの)底が抜ける
The bottom comes out.
底を抜く
to knock the bottom out
喜太八が風呂桶の底を抜いた
Kidahachi knocked out the bottom of the bath-tub.
底の厚い靴、底の薄い靴
thick-soled shoes―thin-soled shoes
この靴は底を取替えなければならぬ
These shoes want resoling―(は英、米は)―need resoling.
財布の底をはたく
to empty one's purse
上げ底になっている
(箱なら)The box has a false bottom―(徳利なら)―The bottle has a kick.
心の底
the bottom of one's heart―the depths of one's heart―the recesses of one's heart
心の底ではそう思っている
She thinks so in the depths of her heart―in her heart of hearts.
心の底から出る言葉だ
Those words come from the bottom of his heart―come out of the depths of his heart.
心の底を打明ける
to reveal one's inmost heart―disclose one's inmost thoughts―to another
人の心の底を見抜く
to see into one's heart―penetrate into one's motive
心の底が見え透いている
His motive is apparent.
底が透いて見える
That's too thin.
心の底まで腐っている
Her heart is rotten to the core.
心の底を割る
to confess everything―make a clean breast of it
腹の底の知しれない人だ
He is a deep one.
底に底あり
There are wheels within wheels.
彼はどこまで慾が深いか底が知れない
His avarice knows no bounds.
底の知れないばかだ
He is a desperate fool―an egregious fool―a holy imbecile.
底痛い
I feel a dull pain.
底力のある声
a deep tone of voice
底気味の悪い静かさだ
The silence is ominous.

content: 2. ［値段］The bottom price

content.content: 底で買って天井で売る
to buy at the bottom price and sell at the top price

content:
そご〔齟齬〕
〈名〉
1. (=不一致)disagreement; variance; conflict; contradiction; inconsistency; discrepancy:(=する) to disagree, conflict, clash, jar (with each other); to contradict (each other); to be at variance (with each other); to be inconsistent (with each other); to be discrepant

content.content: 二人の話が齟齬している
The two accounts do not agree with each other―conflict with each other―clash with each other―jar with each other―contradict each other.
彼の陳述は事実と齟齬している
His statement is at variance with the facts.
君は齟齬したことを言うじゃないか
You contradict yourself.
君の言うことはかねての主義と齟齬している
Your remark is inconsistent with your principles.
約束と履行とが齟齬している
There is a discrepancy between the promise and the performance.

content: 2. (=手違い)a mishap; a mischance; a misadventure; a miscarriage; something wrong:(=する) to miscarry; to go wrong; to come to grief; to fall through; to go to the ground; to be dashed to earth

content.content: すること成すこと万事齟齬した
Everything went wrong with me.
戦争のためにせっかくの計画が齟齬してしまった
Owing to the war, my dear scheme has miscarried―come to grief―fallen through―gone to the ground―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The war has dashed my scheme to earth.

content:

to be prudent(in one's conduct)

to amend(one's conduct)―mend one's ways―reform(oneself)―turn over a new leaf―do better

content:

content.content: 儀式をそこそこに済ます
to hurry through a ceremony
旅の用意もそこそこに便船を待って出発した
Hurrying through my preparations for a journey, I started by the next steamer.
支度もそこそこに出て行った

型ばかりの法会をそこそこに済ました

荷造りもそこそこに都を立った
He went packing out of town.
暇乞いもそこそこに旅行に出た
Taking a hasty leave of my friends, I set out on my journey.
同勢をまとめてそこそこに引き揚げた
I got my men together, and beat a hasty retreat.

そこぢからある〔底力ある〕
〈形〉Deep (tone of voice)

content:
そこつ〔粗忽〕
〈名〉
1. (=不注意)carelessness; heedlessness; absence of mind:(=な) careless; heedless; absent-minded:(=に) carelessly; heedlessly; without due deliberation

content.content: 彼は粗忽にも勘定を払うのを忘れて行った
He was so heedless as to forget to pay his bill.
君は粗忽に取りきめたのが悪かった
You have done wrong in arranging the matter without due consideration.
あの人は粗忽で時々家を間違える
He is so absent-minded that he often enters the wrong house by mistake.
粗忽で時々馬鹿な失錯をする
His absence of mind often makes him commit foolish blunders.
あの人の粗忽は有名だ
His absence of mind is proverbial.
粗忽者
an absent-minded man

content: 2. (=不注意の失錯)a careless mistake; an oversight; a blunder

content.content: それは僕の粗忽でした
It was an oversight on my part.
これはとんだ粗忽を致しました
What have I done!―How stupid of me!―How awkward of me!
粗忽の罪を謝した
I apologized for my mistake.
粗忽も時の一興
A mistake is sometimes a cause of pleasant mirth.

content:
そこづみ〔底積み〕

content.content: その荷物は底積みになっているからちょっと出せない
We can't get at the goods, for they are stowed beneath.

content:
そこで〔其処で〕
〈副〉
1. (=ところで)upon this; hereupon; thereupon; whereupon

content.content: そこで一趣向を案じた

content: 2. (=さて)now

content.content: そこで一つご相談がある
Now, I have a proposal to make.

content:
そこない〔損い〕
〈接尾詞〉A failure; a miss; a slip

content.content: 言い損いだ
It was a slip of the tongue―a lapse of the tongue.
書き損いだ
It was a slip of the pen―a lapse of the pen.
出来損い
a botch―a bungle
(相撲取りなどに向って)この生まれ損いめ
You misshapen creature!
(老人に向かって)この死に損いめ
You dotard!―You old imbecile!

content:
そこなう〔損う〕
〈他動〉(=害する)to harm; to hurt; to injure; to impair; to damage; to spoil; to ruin; to mar

content.content: 健康を損う
to injure one's health―impair one's health―ruin one's health
彼はひどく健康を損っている
His health is ruined―He has a broken constitution.
身体を損う
to ruin one's constitution―undermine one's constitution
彼は身体を損って帰って来た
He returned with a ruined constitution―with a broken constitution.
人の感情を損う
to hurt one's feelings―wound one's pride
風景の美を損う
to impair the beauty of scenery―spoil the scenery
あの広告がせっかくの風景を損う
Those advertisements spoil the scenery.
美貌を損う
to mar one's beauty―spoil one's good looks―disfigure one's face

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=何々し損じる)to fail (to do something) ; to miss (doing something); to do (something) amiss; to come near (doing something)

content.content: 遣り損なう
to fail―miss one's tip―spoil the game
見損なう
to fail to see―miss seeing―see amiss―missee―mistake―err
僕は相手を見損なったことが無い
I never mistook my man.
あの人が一つにらんだら見損なうことは無い
His judgment never errs.
聞き損なう
to fail to hear―miss hearing―hear amiss―mishear
あの人の演説を聞き損なった
I have missed hearing him.
当て損う
to guess amiss―guess wrong―misguess
狙い損なう
to aim amiss―aim wrong―misaim
言い損なう
to say amiss―missay―make a slip of the tongue
書き損なう
to write amiss―miswrite―make a slip of the pen
出来損なう
to botch one's work―bungle one's work―slobber one's work
今度の作は出来損った
My new work is botched―bungled―slobbered.
金持ちになり損なった
I missed being a rich man―I might have been a rich man.
洋行し損なった
I missed (my chance of) going abroad―I might have gone abroad.
鳥を撃ち損なった
I missed a bird.
たいがいの人はこの問題を解き損う
Most people fail to solve this problem―fail in solving this problem.
逃げ損なって自首した者がある
Some failed to effect their escape―despaired of escape―and surrendered themselves to justice.
可哀そうに出損なって焼け死んだ者がある
Some poor fellows could not get out, and were burnt to death.
あの河で死に損なったことがある
I once came near being drowned in that river―I was once very nearly drowned in that river―I once just missed being drowned in that river―I was once in imminent peril of drowning in that river.
この崖から落ち損なったことがある
I once came near falling over this precipice―I once very nearly fell over this precipice―I once just missed falling over this precipice.
自動車にひかれ損なった
A motor-car very nearly ran over me―went near to run over me―just missed running over me.
船が衝突し損なった
The ships were very nearly colliding with each other―The ships just missed colliding with each other―The ships were in imminent peril of colliding with each other.

content:
そこに〔底荷〕
〈名〉Ballast

content.content: 船に底荷を積む
to ballast a ship
船が(帰り荷を積まずに)底荷で帰る
A ship returns in ballast.

そこぬけ〔底抜〕
〈形〉Careless; negligent; slovenly; improvident; loose

content:
そこぬけさわぎ〔底抜け騒ぎ〕
〈名〉A boisterous merry-making; a lively frolic; a riotous revelry; a riot; a revel; a racket; a spree; high jinks:(=する) to make merry; to revel; to riot; to have high jinks; to go on a racket; to go on the spree; to paint the sky red; to paint the town red

content.content: 一座は底抜け騒ぎをして一夜を明かした
The company passed the night in riotous revelry―They were on the spree all night.
船乗りは陸へ上がって底抜け騒ぎをする
Sailors like to make merry on shore.

そこぬけじょうご〔底抜け上戸〕
〈名〉An insatiable drinker; a soaker

content:
そこね〔底値〕
〈名〉The bottom price; the bed-rock price

content.content: 底値で買って天井で売る
to buy at the bottom price and sell at the top price

content:
そこねる〔損ねる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: そこなう〔損う〕

そこばく〔若干〕
〈形〉Some (money); a number of (men, etc.)

content:
そこびかり〔底光り〕
〈名〉A lurid light

content.content: 底光りのある目つき
a lurid glance

content:
そこまで〔其処まで〕
〈副〉As far as that(は場所):(程度なら)so far; to that extent

content.content: そこまでいっしょに行こう
I will go a little way with you.
そこまでは尋ねなかった
I did not inquire so far.
そこまでは信用してくれぬ
He does not trust me so far―to that extent.

content:
そこまめ〔底豆〕
〈名〉A blister on the sole of the foot

content.content: あまり遠道をして足に底豆を出した
I walked so far that my soles were blistered.

そこもと〔其処許〕
〈代名詞〉You

content:
そこら〔其処ら〕
〈副〉About that; about there; (ten miles) or thereabouts; (one mile) or so

content.content: そこらを捜してご覧
Look there!
ちょっとそこらへ行って見て来る
I am going to look about me.
一ダースかそこらあればたくさんだ
A dozen or so will do.
価はなんでも十円かそこらだ
The price is ten yen or thereabouts.
まあそこらだろう
That's about it―That's about the size of it.

content:
そこらあたり〔其処ら辺り〕
〈副〉About there; (100) or thereabouts; (somewhere) about (100); in the neighbourhood of (100) ; in the vicinity of (100)

content.content: 東京の人口は二百万かそこらあたりだ
The population of Tokyo is 2,000,000 or thereabouts―in the neighbourhood of 2,000,000.

content:
そこらじゅう〔其処ら中〕
〈副〉All over there

content.content: そこら中に散らかっている
They are scattered all over the place.

content:
そさい〔蔬菜〕
〈名〉Vegetables; greens

content.content: 蔬菜園
a kitchen-garden―a market-garden―a kale-yard

content:
そざつ〔粗雑〕
〈形〉Rough; rude; coarse

content.content: 彼は粗雑な人間だ
He is a man of coarse fibre.
粗雑な頭だ
He has a coarse brain.
この絵の運筆は極めて粗雑だ
The painting is roughly drawn.

content:
そさん〔粗餐〕
〈名〉A plain dinner

content.content: 粗餐をさし上げたい
Will you favour me with your company at dinner?

content:
そさん〔素餐〕
〈名〉A sinecure; sinecurism

content.content: 尸位素餐{しいそさん}の人
a sinecurist

そし〔祖師〕
〈名〉The founder (of a sect)

content:
そし〔素志〕
〈名〉One's original object; a cherished object; a cherished desire

content.content: 素志を貫徹する
to attain one's cherished object―obtain one's cherished desire
彼は年来の素志を貫いた
He has attained his long-cherished object.
素志をなげうつ
to abandon one's original object
素志を翻さず
I have ever kept my original object in view.

content:
そし〔阻止〕
〈名〉Obstruction; interception:(=する) to obstruct (traffic); to intercept (the light); to check (the enemy); to cross, thwart (one's design, etc.)

content.content: 通行を阻止する
to obstruct traffic―bar the way
敵の前進を阻止する
to check the enemy's advance―hold the enemy in check

content:
そじ〔措辞〕
〈名〉Phraseology; diction; wording

content.content: この詩は措辞が綺麗だ
The poem is prettily worded.
措辞の妙を尽くしている
It is exquisite in diction.

content:
そしき〔組織〕
〈名〉
1. (=組立)organization; formation; composition; constitution; construction; structure; economy:(=する) to organize; to form; to compose; to constitute; to construct

content.content: 内閣を組織する
to organize a cabinet―form a ministry
会社を組織する
to organize a company―form a company
会社を法人組織にする
to incorporate a company
会の組織を改める
to change the constitution of a society―reorganize a society
彼は組織の才が有る
He has a talent for organization―He has constructive faculty.
社会の組織
social organization―the structure o society
宇宙の組織
the economy of the universe
蜂の巣の内部の組織を研究すると面白い
It is interesting to study the internal economy of a bee-hive.
組織体
an organism

content: 2. (=系統)system:(=的) systematic:(=的に) systematically; on system

content.content: 語学研究などに組織を立てる
to systematize language-study―reduce language-study to system
教授法は組織が立っている
The method of teaching is systematic.
この本は材料は豊富だが組織が立っていない
The book is rich in materials, but unsystematic in arrangement.
組織を立てて組織的に英語を研究する
to study English on system
組織的研究
systematic study
組織神学
systematic theology

content: 3. (=生物組織)tissue; organic tissues; texture

content.content: 血液は組織の欠損を補う
Blood repairs the tissues.
黴菌が組織に食い込む
The bacilli enter the tissues.
神経組織
nervous tissue
筋肉組織
muscular tissue
組織学
histology

content:
そしつ〔素質〕
〈名〉
1. (=心の素質)stuff; making

content.content: 人間の素質が良好だ
He is made of good stuff.
この少年は偉人の素質を具えている
The boy has in him the making of a great man.

content: 2. (=身体の素質) (constitutional) predisposition; diathesis

content.content: 彼は肺病の素質が有る
He has a disposition to consumption―He is constitutionally disposed to consumption―He has consumptive diathesis.

content:
そしな〔粗品〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: そひん〔粗品〕

content:
そしゃく〔租借〕
〈名〉Lease (of territory):(=する) to lease (a territory)

content.content: 日本は遼東半島を租借している
Japan holds a lease of the Liaotung Peninsula.
租借地
a leased territory
租借権
lease

content:
そしゃく〔咀嚼〕
〈名〉
1. (=噛み砕くこと) mastication:(=する) to masticate; to chew
2. (=読みこなして味うこと)digestion; assimilation; appreciation:(=する) to digest; to assimilate; to appreciate

content.content: 本を読んでも咀嚼しなければなんの益も無い
Books will do you no good, unless you digest what you read.
咀嚼玩味すべき作だ
It is a work worthy of being appreciated.

content:
そじゅつ〔祖述〕
〈名〉Exposition of another's doctrine:(=する) to expound (another's doctrine)

content.content: 祖述者
an exponent

content:
そしょう〔訴訟〕
〈名〉A lawsuit; a suit (-at-law) ; an action (at law) :(抽象的に言えば) litigation; legal proceedings:(=する) to litigate; to go to law; to sue (for a debt) ; to prosecute (for damages, etc.)

content.content: (人を相手どって)訴訟を起こす
to bring an action against one―institute a suit against one―commence legal proceedings against one―proceed against one―go to law with one
それでは損害要償の訴訟を起こします
Then I shall sue you for damages.
損害要償の訴訟
an action for damages
名誉毀損の訴訟を起こす
to prosecute one for defamation
僅かばかりの貸金請求に訴訟を起こしては割りに合わぬ
It does not pay to sue for small debts.
訴訟に勝つ
to win a lawsuit―win one's cause
訴訟に負ける
to lose a lawsuit―lose one's cause―be cast in a lawsuit
この事件は訴訟になる
The case is actionable―litigious.
あの人は訴訟が好きだ
He is litigious.
訴訟は数年に亙った
The legal proceedings extended over several years.
事件は訴訟中
The case is pending in court―pendent―in pendency―on trial.
訴訟事件
a case―a cause―a lawsuit
訴訟手続
legal procedure―legal proceedings
訴訟手続きをする
to proceed against one
訴訟人
a suitor―a plaintiff
訴訟関係人
a litigant
訴訟当事者
the litigants―the parties to a suit
訴訟代理人
an attorney―an attorney-at-law
訴訟鑑定
chamber-practice
訴訟代理人
chamber-counsel
訴訟入費及び損害
costs and damages
訴訟入費は原告の負担たるべし
The plaintiff shall bear the costs.
行政訴訟
administrative litigation

そじょう〔疏状〕
〈名〉An explanatory letter

content:
そじょう〔訴状〕
〈名〉A complaint; a petition

content.content: 訴状を奉る
to present a petition―prefer a complaint

content:
そしょく〔粗食〕
〈名〉Coarse food; poor fare; hard fare; plain diet; low diet; low feeding; low living:(=する) to live low; to feed low

content.content: 彼は粗衣粗食に甘んじている
He is content with poor clothes and poor fare―content with plain living.
粗衣粗食の学者生活
plain living and high thinking

content:
そしらぬ〔素知らぬ〕
〈形〉Feigning ignorance

content.content: 素知らぬ顔をする
to feign ignorance―pretend not to Know―put on an innocent air
彼は素知らぬ顔をして眺めている
He looks on with an innocent air.
素知らぬ顔をして通り過ぎた
He passed by me without taking notice of me.

content:
そしり〔誹り〕
〈名〉
1. (=誹謗)calumny; slander; libel; defamation; abuse; aspersion; detraction; disparagement; depreciation; vilification; traducement
2. (=非難)blame; censure; charge

content.content: 彼の処置は緩慢の誹りを免れぬ
His conduct is open to the charge of laxity.
そんことをしては世の誹りを招く
You would lay yourself open to public censure by doing such a thing―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will lay you open to public censure.

content:
そしる〔誹る〕
〈他動〉To calumniate, slander, libel, defame, asperse, revile, abuse, depreciate, disparage, traduce, vilify (a man) ; to detract from one's merits; to speak ill of (a man) ; to run down, cry down, decry (one's country, etc.)

content.content: 人を誹るものでない
You should not speak ill of others.
名人は人を誹らず
Great men never speak ill of others.
人を誹るような精神はもうとう無い
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to detract from other's merits.
死んだ人を誹るものでない
You should never speak ill of the dead―“Nil nisi bonum.”
御国を誹られて黙っておれぬ
I can not bear to hear my country run down.
蔭で人を誹る
to speak ill of a man behind his back―backbite a man
面前で人を賞める者に限って蔭で誹る
A man who praises you to your face, is sure to speak ill of you behind your back.
蔭で誹る人
a backbiter

content:
そすい〔疏水〕
〈名〉Drainage

content.content: 琵琶湖疏水
the drainage of Lake Biwa―the Biwa canal

drainage works
湖水の氾濫を防ぐために疏水工事をした
Drainage works were undertaken to prevent the inundation of the lake.

〈名〉A prime number

そする〔蘇する〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: そせい〔蘇生〕

content:
そせい〔粗製〕
〈名〉Careless manufacture; crude manufacture; coarse manufacture:(=する) to manufacture carelessly:(=の) coarse; crude

content.content: 粗製品
coarse manufactures―crude articles―shoddy goods
粗製食塩
crude salt
粗製糖
raw sugar―unrefined sugar
粗製濫造
careless manufacture and excessive production―sacrifice of quality to quantity
日本の製造家は粗製濫造する
Japanese manufacturers sacrifice quality to quantity.
日本品は粗製濫造の非難が高い
Japanese goods are loudly condemned for their careless manufacture.

content:
そせい〔組成〕
〈名〉Composition; constitution; formation:(=する) to compose; to constitute; to form; to make up

content.content: 人民と政府が国家を組成する
People and government compose―constitute―form―the State.
国家は人民と政府より組成せらる
The State is composed of―is formed of―is made up of―consists of―people and government.
組成物
a composite―a composition
組成分
a component (part)―a constituent (element)
組成体
an organism

content:
そせい〔蘇生〕
〈名〉Revival; resuscitation:(=する) to revive; to resuscitate, be resuscitated; to come to life; to be brought to life; to be restored to life; to return to life:(=させる) to revive; to resuscitate; to bring (one) to life; to restore (one) to life

content.content: (気絶した人が)蘇生した
He has come to (himself).
冷たい風に当たって蘇生した
The cold air brought him to (himself).
(気絶した人を)蘇生させる
to bring a man to (himself)―fetch a man from a swoon
人工呼吸で蘇生した
He was brought to life―resuscitated―by artificial respiration―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Artificial respiration brought him to life―resuscitated him.
会社がいったん破産しかけたがまた蘇生した
The company came near failing, but revived.
蘇生の思いする
I feel myself another man―feel myself a new man.
夏の暑い日に夕立が来ると蘇生の思いする
A cool shower revives us on a hot summer day.

content:
そぜい〔租税〕
〈名〉A tax:(課税の意味に用いれば) taxation

content.content: 租税を課す
to tax anything―impose a tax on anything―levy a tax on anything
租税を徴集する
to collect the taxes
租税を納める
to pay the taxes
租税を免除する
to exempt a person from taxes―exempt an article from the tax
人民は租税に苦しむ
The people groan under the burden of taxation―The taxes bear hard on the people.

そせいぶつ〔組成物〕
〈名〉A composite; a composition

そせいぶん〔組成分〕
〈名〉A component (part); a constituent (element)

content:
そせん〔祖先〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: せんぞ〔先祖〕
祖先の遺風を守る
to keep to the customs of one's fathers
祖先の遺訓を守る
to observe the teachings of one's fathers
祖先を辱むるなかれ
Do not disgrace your fathers!

そそう〔祖宗〕
〈名〉(One's) ancestors, predecessors, forefathers, fathers

content:
そそう〔粗相〕
〈名〉
1. (=不注意)carelessness; heedlessness:(=な) careless; heedless

content.content: あの人は仕事が粗相だ
He is a careless worker―He slights his work.
やり方が粗相だ
It is carelessly done.
こんなことになったのは私の粗相からです
This has happened through my carelessness.
私が粗相でした
I was careless―It was careless of me.
客人に粗相の無いように
Be careful in your attentions to the guest!

content: 2. (=不注意の失錯)a careless mistake; an oversight; a blunder; a fault; an accident

content.content: 粗相をする
to make a mistake―commit a blunder―commit a fault
これはとんだ粗相を致しました
What have I done!―How stupid of me!―How awkward of me!
これは私の粗相でした
It was an oversight on my part.
よその家へ行って粗相をしないようになさい
You must mind your P's and Q's while on a visit.
子どもが粗相をした
The child has dirtied its clothes.
女中が粗相をして皿をこわした
The servant has broken a plate by mistake―by accident.
粗相火
an accidental fire

content:
そそう〔沮喪〕
〈名〉Depression; dispiritedness; discouragement; dejection; despondency:(=する) to despond; to be depressed; to be dispirited; to be dejected; to be discouraged; to be disheartened; to be daunted

content.content: 彼はどんなことがあっても沮喪するということが無い
Nothing can daunt him―dishearten him―discourage him―deject him.
意気沮喪
depression of spirits
彼は意気が沮喪している
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―dispirited―despondent―dejected―cast down.
失望したために意気が沮喪したのだ
Disappointment damped his spirits.
士気沮喪
demoralization
士気沮喪する
to become demoralized
軍隊の士気が沮喪している
The troops are demoralized.
この一敗で軍隊の士気が沮喪した
The defeat demoralized the troops.
全級士気沮喪している
The whole class is dispirited.

そぞう〔塑像〕
〈名〉A clay image; a clay figure

そぞう〔粗造〕
〈名〉Rude construction; coarse manufacture:(=の) rudely constructed; coarse; crude

そぞうじゅつ〔塑造術〕
〈名〉The plastic arts

そそうび〔粗相火〕
〈名〉An accidental fire

content:
そそぐ〔雪ぐ〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: すすぐ〔雪ぐ〕

content:
そそぐ〔注ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=水などを掛ける)to pour

content.content: 水を注ぐ
to pour water on (or over) anything
花に水を注ぐ
to water the flowers
田に水を注ぐ
to irrigate the rice-fields
焼けている家に水を注ぐ
The fire-engine plays on a house on fire.
敵陣に銃弾を注ぐ
to pour bullets into the enemy's ranks
彼は怒って満面朱を注いだ
He turned red with anger―flushed with rage.

content: 2. (=河が海に落ちる)to pour itself into, fall into, flow into, empty into (the sea)

content.content: 隅田川は東京湾に注ぐ
The Sumida empties into the Bay of Tokyo.
目を注ぐ
to turn one's eyes on―fix one's eyes on―Keep an eye on―eye―anything
皆あの女に目を注いでいる
Everybody eyes her.
心を注ぐ
to give one's mind to―direct one's attention to―anything
職務に意を注ぐべし
You must give your mind to your duties.
身は閑地に在りながら彼は天下の形勢に意を注いでいる
Although in private life, he directs his attention to the signs of the times.
意を注いで聴け
Pay attention to me!
全力を注ぐ
to do one's best―do one's utmost―throw all one's energies into the work
全力を注いで働いた
I worked with all my might.
仕事に全心全力を注ぐ
to give oneself, body and soul, to―devote all one's energies to―one's work
彼は何事にも全心全力を注ぐ質だ
He goes, heart and soul, into any scheme.
熱血を注ぐ、心血を注ぐ
to put one's heart into―put one's soul into―put one's life into―one's work
彼が熱血を注いだ作だ
It is a work he put his heart into.

content:
そそぐ〔嗽ぐ〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: すすぐ〔嗽ぐ、濯ぐ〕

そぞく〔鼠賊〕
〈名〉A sneak-thief; a pilferer

content:
そぞく〔鼠族〕
〈名〉Rats and mice; vermin(は集合名詞)

content.content: 鼠族を駆除する
to exterminate vermin―rid a house of vermin

そそくさ
〈副〉In haste; in a hurry

content:
そそっかしい
〈形〉Hasty; heedless; absent-minded

content.content: あまりそそっかしいものだから紙入れを忘れて来た
I forgot my purse in my hurry.
あの人はそそっかしいから時々帽子を忘れて行く
He is so heedless that he often forgets his hat.
彼はそそっかしくて時々家を間違える
He is so absent-minded that he often enters the wrong house.
あの人のそそっかしいのは有名だ
His absence of mind is proverbial―He is proverbially absent-minded.

content:
そそのかす〔唆す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=誘惑する)to tempt; to allure; to entice; to decoy; to inveigle; to seduce; to steal away one's heart

content.content: あの役者は娘子をそそのかすのが商売だ
He makes it his business to steal away the hearts of young girls.
女が男にそそのかされて親の金を持って逃げた
Her lover enticed her to make off with her father's money.
不良少年は良家の子女をそそのかして邪道に導く
