彼は何事も率先して新しいことを始める
He takes the lead―takes the initiative―in everything new.
米国は率先して酒類販売業禁止を断行した

America took the initiative in prohibiting the sale of alcoholic liquors―America was the first country to prohibit the sale of alcoholic liquors―America set an example of prohibition to other countries.
率先者
a leader―a pioneer

content:
そっせん〔卒先、率先〕
〈名〉Leadership:(=する) to take the lead (in doing anything); to take the initiative (in doing anything)

content.content: 佐久間象山が率先して洋式を用いた
Sakuma Shozan took the lead in adopting things Western.
彼は何事も率先して新しいことを始める
He takes the lead―takes the initiative―in everything new.
米国は率先して酒類販売業禁止を断行した

America took the initiative in prohibiting the sale of alcoholic liquors―America was the first country to prohibit the sale of alcoholic liquors―America set an example of prohibition to other countries.
率先者
a leader―a pioneer

content:
そっち〔其方〕
〈代名詞〉
1. That

content.content: そっちよりこっちが好い
This is better than that.

content: 2. You

content.content: そっちが悪い
You are in the wrong.

content: 〈副〉There

content.content: 今そっちへ行く
I will be there presently.

content:
そっちのけにする〔そっち退けにする〕
〈他動〉To lay aside; to neglect; to ignore; to leave (anything) out of account; to leave (anything) out of consideration; to leave (one) out in the cold

content.content: 彼は本をそっちのけにして遊んでいる
He lays his books aside to play all the time.
勉強をそっちのけにして遊んでばかりいる
He neglects his studies, and plays all the time―Instead of working, he is playing all the time.
彼は事実をそっちのけにして勝手な説を立てる
He ignores the facts, and forms whimsical theories―He forms whimsical theories, irrespective of facts.
彼は身分などをそっちのけにして誰とでも付合う
He mixes with all people, leaving their rank out of account―leaving their rank out of consideration.
僕をそっちのけにして二人きりで話しばかりしている
They keep talking by themselves, leaving me out in the cold.

content:
そっちゅう〔卒中〕
〈名〉Apoplexy

content.content: 卒中にかかる
to have a stroke of apoplexy
卒中にかかって倒れた
He was struck down by apoplexy.
卒中で死んだ
He died of apoplexy.

content:
そっちょく〔卒直〕
〈形〉Blunt; plain-spoken; outspoken; straightforward

content.content: 彼は卒直な軍人だ
He is a blunt soldier.
彼は卒直にものを言う
He is plain-spoken―outspoken.
あの卒直なところが気に入った
I like his plain-speaking.
その女は何を尋ねても卒直な返答をしない
She never gives straightforward answers to my questions.

content:
そっと
〈副〉
1. (=静かに)softly; gently; lightly; tenderly; gingerly

content.content: 人が目を覚ますといけないからそっと歩け
Tread softly lest you should awaken anybody!
そっと歩いたから誰も知らなかった
Nobody noticed my soft tread.
そっと家を出た
I stole out of the house with soft steps―with stealthy steps.
そっと下ろせ
Lay it down gently!
そっと肩を叩いた
I gave him a light tap on the shoulder.
子どもをそっと抱き上げた
I took the child tenderly in my arms.
痛い所へ触れるようにそっと扱う
to handle anything gingerly
子どもをそっと寝かしておけ
Leave the child asleep, as it is.

content: 2. (=密かに)secretly; in secret; in private; in confidence; by stealth, stealthily; furtively; on the sly

content.content: 彼にそっと知らせた
I told him in secret―in private―in confidence.
彼の室へそっと忍び込んだ
I stole into his room.
どさくさまぎれにそっと家を抜け出た
Benefiting by the confusion. I stole out of the house.
彼はどうしても聞かないからそっと金を握らせた
As he would not listen to me, I slipped a coin into his hand.
男が女の袂へそっと手紙を入れた
He slipped a letter into her sleeve.
彼はそっと人の顔を覗く
He looks furtively in your face―He casts furtive glances on people.
彼は隣の人の答案をそっと覗いた
He peeped at his neighbour's paper.
酒盛りが容易に済みそうもないからそっと帰って来た
As they seemed in no hurry to leave off drinking, I took French leave.

content:
そっと〔卒土〕
〈名〉The beach; a land's end

content.content: 普天の下卒土の浜ことごとく王土ならざるはなし
Every inch of ground within the realm owns its lord in the Emperor.

content:
そっとう〔卒倒〕
〈名〉A fainting fit; a swoon:(=する) to faint; to swoon; to fall into a swoon; to fall insensible; to fall senseless; to fall unconscious; to lose one's consciousness; to lose one's senses; to be stunned

content.content: 彼は頭を打たれて卒倒した
He was stunned by a blow on the head―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A blow on the head stunned him.

content:
ぞっとする〔ゾッとする〕
〈自動〉
1. To shudder; to shiver; to feel a thrill

content.content: ゾッとした
(いやでなら)A shudder ran through me―(嬉しくてなら)―A thrill ran through me.
想像したばかりでもゾッとする
I shudder at the bare idea―The bare idea makes me shudder.
どうなるかと思うとゾッとする
I shudder to think how it will end―It makes me shudder to think how it will end.
すんでのことにこの崖から落ちそこなったかと思うとゾッとする
The idea that I came near falling over this precipice makes my blood run cold―curdless my blood.
そういう勇ましい話を聞くとゾッとする
Such stirring tales send a thrill through me.
ゾッとするような勇ましい話だ
It is a thrilling tale.
恐ろしい人殺しの話を聞いてゾッとした
The tale of horrible murder gave me the shivers.
ゾッとするような恐ろしい話だ
It is a gruesome tale.
ゾッとするほどいやな人だ
I abhor the man―I loathe the man―I detest the man―He is a detestable man.
この文章はあまりゾッとしない
I can't say much for the style.
支那料理はゾッとしない
I don't care much for Chinese food.

content:
ぞっとする〔ゾッとする〕
〈自動〉
1. To shudder; to shiver; to feel a thrill

content.content: ゾッとした
(いやでなら)A shudder ran through me―(嬉しくてなら)―A thrill ran through me.
想像したばかりでもゾッとする
I shudder at the bare idea―The bare idea makes me shudder.
どうなるかと思うとゾッとする
I shudder to think how it will end―It makes me shudder to think how it will end.
すんでのことにこの崖から落ちそこなったかと思うとゾッとする
The idea that I came near falling over this precipice makes my blood run cold―curdless my blood.
そういう勇ましい話を聞くとゾッとする
Such stirring tales send a thrill through me.
ゾッとするような勇ましい話だ
It is a thrilling tale.
恐ろしい人殺しの話を聞いてゾッとした
The tale of horrible murder gave me the shivers.
ゾッとするような恐ろしい話だ
It is a gruesome tale.
ゾッとするほどいやな人だ
I abhor the man―I loathe the man―I detest the man―He is a detestable man.
この文章はあまりゾッとしない
I can't say much for the style.
支那料理はゾッとしない
I don't care much for Chinese food.

content:
そっぱ〔反歯〕
〈名〉Projecting teeth; a buck-tooth

content.content: あの人は反歯だ
He is buck-toothed.

content:
ソップ
〈名〉(=スープ)Soup; broth

content.content: ソップを吸う
to eat soup―take broth
澄ましソップ
clear soup―consomm?
鶏肉ソップ
chicken broth
野菜ソップ
vegetable soup
ソップ一皿
a dish of soup
ソップ皿
a soup-plate
ソップ入れ
a tureen
ソップ匙
a table-spoon
ソップ肉
soup-meat

content:
そっぽう〔相貌〕
〈名〉Physiognomy; features; lineaments; looks

content.content: 相貌が好い
She is good-looking―She has good looks.

content:
そで〔袖〕
〈名〉
1. A sleeve:(洋服の袖)an arm

content.content: 袖を引く
to pull one by the sleeve―pluck one by the sleeve―(口説くの意味なら)―make love to one―(淫売婦が男を引張るの意味なら)―solicit a man
誰か袖を引く人があるなと思った
I felt some one pull me by the sleeve―I felt myself pulled by the sleeve.
彼女は袖を引いて放さなかった
She held me by the sleeve―(西洋ふうに言えば)―held me by the button―buttonholed me.
袖にすがる
to hang on one's sleeve―(歎願するの意味なら)―entreat one to do something―(哀願するの意味なら)―appeal to one for mercy
袞龍の袖に隠る
to shelter oneself behind the throne
袖を絞る、袖を潤す
to wet one's sleeves with tears
袖に干ぬのは女の身
Woman must weep.
袖の涙の乾く間も無し
My sleeves are always wet with tears.
君はまだ遠くは
Thou canst not yet
行かじ我袖の
Be far from here:
袂の涙
Still moist on my sleeve
乾き果てねば
Is the parting tear.
袖が千切れた
The sleeve is torn off.
袖を捲くる
(和服なら)to turn up one's sleeves―(洋服なら)―turn up one's cuffs
着物の袖を通す
to put on clothes―wear clothes
袖を通さない着物
unworn clothes―bran-new clothes
袖を通した着物
worn clothes
人の袖を控える
to hold one back
袖を連ねて辞職する
to resign in a body
女が男を袖にする
A girl jilts her lover.
無い袖は振られぬ
One can make nothing out of nothing.
無い袖は振られないじゃないか
How can I make anything out of nothing?
袖擦り合うも他生の縁
A chance acquaintance is a divine ordinance.
袖の下
a bribe
袖の移り香
recollection of a meeting
(洋服の)袖口
a cuff―a wrist-band
(洋服の)袖付け
an armhole
(洋服の)袖裏
the lining of the arms
袖無し
a sleeveless coat

content: 2. (=建物の袖)a wing (to a building)

content.content: 建物に袖を足す
to add a wing to a building

content:
そでうら〔袖裏〕
〈名〉The lining of the arms

content.content: 外套の袖裏が切れた
The lining of the arms of my overcoat is worn out.

そでがき〔袖垣〕
〈名〉A low fence

そでがらみ〔袖搦み〕
〈名〉A pronged spear (for hooking people)

そでぐくり〔袖括り〕
〈名〉A string to gather the opening of a sleeve

content:
そでくち〔袖口〕
〈名〉The opening of a sleeve:(洋服のは)a cuff; a wrist-band

content.content: 袖口をくくる
to gather the opening of a sleeve
紺の上衣に赤の襟や袖口
a blue coat with red facing

そでごい〔袖乞い〕
〈名〉(事)begging:(人) a beggar:(=する) to beg (for alms)

content:
そでつけ〔袖付け〕
〈名〉Armhole

content.content: 袖付けが窮屈でないようにしておくれ
Do not make the armholes too tight.

そでなし〔袖無し〕
〈名〉A sleeveless coat

content:
そでのした〔袖の下〕
〈名〉A bribe

content.content: 袖の下を使う
to bribe an official―grease one's palm―oil one's hand

content:
そでびょうぶ〔袖屏風〕
〈名〉Hiding one's face with one's sleeve

content.content: 赤らむ顔の袖屏風
She hid her blushes behind her sleeve.

content:
そと〔外〕
〈名〉The outside; the exterior; the open air; the streets:(=の) outer; outside; outward; outdoor; external; exterior:(=で、=に、=は) out; outside; without; out of doors; in the open air; in the streets; abroad

content.content: 外は寒い
It is cold without.
外はまだ明るい
It is still light outside.
外は賑やかだ
The streets are thronged with people.
外で遊べ
Play out of doors!―Play (out) in the street!
僕は毎日外で運動する
I take exercise out of doors―in the open air―every day.
今日は外で食事をする
I dine out today.
外へ出る
to go out―go out of doors―go out into the open air―go out into the streets
君はまだ悪いから外へ出てはいけない
You are not quite well yet. You must not go out of doors―You must keep indoors.
雨が降ってちょっとも外へ出られない
It is raining, and there is no stirring on inch out of doors.
窓から外を覗く
to look out of the window
窓の外から内を覗く
to look in at the window
外から錠を掛ける
to lock the door on the outside
外から見てはさほど立派な家ではない
The house is not very fine on the outside.
外から見たほど立派な家ではない
The house is not so fine as it looks on the outside.
彼は内では強いが外へ出ると弱い
He is a lion at home, a mouse abroad.
男は外を治め女は内を治む
Man is for the field, woman for the hearth.
福は内、鬼は外
In with luck! Out with the demon!
彼は内を外にして出歩いている
He is always on the gad―He is a stranger at home.
彼は外好しの内悪しだ
He hangs up the fiddle when he comes home.
内の恥を外へさらす
to wash one's dirty linen in public

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Out of (the house); outside (the door or gate); (within or) without (the walls)

content.content: 馬車は門の外に待っている
The carriage is waiting outside the gate.
彼は入口の外に立っている
He is standing outside the door.
彼は家の外へはめったに出ない
He seldom goes out of the house―He seldom leaves the house.

そとうみ〔外海〕
〈名〉The open sea; the ocean

content:
そとがまえ〔外構〕
〈名〉
1. (=外面の造り)the outward structure (of a house)
2. (=外観)the outward appearance; the external appearance; the exterior

content.content: 家の外構えは立派だ
The house has a fine exterior.
外構えは立派だが内部はさほどでない
The interior does not correspond with the exterior.

そとがわ〔外側〕
〈名〉The outside; the exterior

そどく〔素読〕
〈名〉Reading (a Chinese text) without comments

content:
そとぐるま〔外車〕
〈名〉(=汽船の外車)A paddle-wheel

content.content: 外車の汽船
a paddle-wheel steamer

そとすずめ〔外雀〕
〈名〉A gadabout

そとば〔卒塔婆〕
〈名〉A wooden tablet (corresponding to a cross over a grave)

content:
そとぼり〔外濠〕
〈名〉The outer moat

content.content: 外濠線
the tramway along the outer moat―the outer-moat line

そとまわり〔外廻り〕
〈名〉The circumference; the perimeter

content:
そとめ〔外目〕
〈名〉An outsider's view

content.content: 外目で見るほど好くはない
It is not so good as it appears.
外目に見えぬ苦労がある
“None but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.”

content:
そとわ〔外輪〕
〈形〉Bandy-legged, bow-legged (person)

content.content: 外輪に歩く
to walk with the toes turned out―toe out

content:
そなえ〔供え〕
〈名〉Offering:(=る) to offer (anything to the gods)

content.content: 神前に供える
to make an offering
神に神饌を供える
to make an offering to the gods
仏に花を供える
to offer flowers to the deceased

content:
そなえ〔備え〕
〈名〉
1. (=貯蓄)provision:(=る) to provide (for the future―against accidents); to lay up, lay by, put by, set by (part of one's earnings)

content.content: 貯蓄して将来に備える
to provide for the future
彼らは現在を楽しんで将来の備えをせぬ
They enjoy the present, and make no provision for the future.
若い時に働いて老後の備えをする
Youth should provide for age.
万一に備える
to provide against accidents―provide against emergencies
万一の必要に備える(不時の必要に備える)ために積金する
A fund is deposited to provide against emergencies―to provide against a possible need.
貯蓄して不幸に備うべし
You should lay by against the evil day―lay up against a rainy day.
蟻や蜂は冬季の備えをする
Ants and bees lay in stores for the winter.

content: 2. (=整備)stock:(=る) to stock (one's mind with knowledge)

content.content: 店に品物を備える
to stock a shop with goods
店には善い品が備えてあります
We keep good articles in stock.
図書館に本を備える
to stock a library with books
図書館には好い本がたくさんに備えてある
The library is stocked with great numbers of good books―(を通例)―The library is well stocked.

content: 3. (=設備)provision; furniture; equipment:(=る) to provide (a house with a bath-room) ; to furnish (a school with desks and benches) ; to equip (a factory with machinery) ; to fit (a ship with necessary appliances) ; to keep (a book for some purpose)

content.content: 気の利いた日本の家には皆風呂場の備えがある
Every respectable Japanese house is provided with a bath-room.
室内には教室のように机や腰掛の備えがある
The room is furnished,like a school-room, with desks and benches.
工場には新式な機械の備えがある
The factory is equipped with up-to-date machinery.
卒業生は世間へ出るに必要な知識を備えている
The graduate is equipped with sufficient knowledge to go out into the world.
船に要具を備える
to fit a ship with the necessary appliances
船には無線電信機の備えがある
The ship is fitted with a wireless apparatus.
船に大砲を備える
to equip a ship with guns―arm a ship with guns
為に帳簿が備えてある
A book is kept for the purpose.
読書家は必ず一本を座右に備えらるべし
The reader must not fail to keep the volume at his elbow―furnish his library with the volume.
速かに一本を座右に備え給え
You should procure a copy without delay.

content: 4. (=予備)reserve:(=る) to reserve (something for some one)

content.content: 彼は余力を備えている(余裕綽々)
He has much in reserve―He has a great reserve of energy.
来訪者のために明間が備えてある
A spare room is reserved for visitors.

content: 5. (=準備)preparation:(=る) to prepare (anything―some one for something) ; to make preparations for (anything)

content.content: 日本は戦争の備えがある
Japan is prepared for war.
国家はあらゆる必要の場合に備うべきものである
The State should be prepared for every emergency―The State should provide against every emergency.
新年の備えをする
to make preparations for the New Year

content: 6. (=具備)possession :(=る) to possess

content.content: 彼は高潔な人格を具えている
He possesses a high character―He is a man of high character.
大将は智と勇とを具えている
The general possesses both ability and valour―combines ability and valour.
彼は多少詩人の性格を具えている
He partakes of the character of a poet.

content: 7. (=防備)preparations for defence; defences

content.content: 備えを厳にする
to strengthen the defences
敵の攻撃に備える
to provide against the enemy's attack

content:
そなえつけ〔備え付け〕
〈名〉Provision; fitting; equipment; attachment:(=る) to provide (a room with a stove) ; to fit (a ship with necessary appliances) ; to equip (a factory with machinery) ; to attach (anything to a place) :(=の) attached (to a place)

content.content: 各室に暖炉が備えつけてある
Each room is provided with a stove.
船には無線電信機が備えつけてある
The ship is fitted with a wireless apparatus.
戦闘艦には巨砲が備えつけてある
A battleship is equipped with monster guns.
教員室に備えつけの書籍
books attached to the teacher's room
この字書は教員室の備えつけだ
The dictionary is attached to the teacher's room.
(往時教会に)備えつけの聖書
a chained bible

content:
そなえもの〔供え物〕
〈名〉An offering; a sacrifice; an oblation

content.content: 供え物をする
to make an offering―make a sacrifice

そなれ〔磯馴〕
〈名〉(=磯馴松)The creeping juniper

content:
そなわる〔具わる〕
〈自動〉(人を主格にすれば)to be endowed with (virtues) ; to possess (virtues) :(具わる物を主格にすれば)to inhere in (a person)

content.content: 彼には人格が具わっている
He is endowed with a great personality.
自然と品格が具わっている
He possesses native dignity.
生まれながらに徳が具わっている
He is endowed with virtues―Virtues inhere in his character.

そにん〔訴人〕
〈名〉A suitor; an accuser; a complainant; an informer:(=する) to sue for (a debt) ; to accuse (a man) ; to complain (to the authorities of a grievance) ; to inform against, lay information against (a man)

content:
そねみ〔嫉み〕
〈名〉Envy; jealousy

content.content: あんなことを言うのは皆そねみだ
They say such things out of envy.

そねみぶかい〔嫉み深い〕
〈形〉Envious (man) ; jealous (nature, etc.)

content:
そねむ〔嫉む〕
〈他動〉To be envious of (one) ; to be jealous of (one's advantages, etc.)

content.content: 彼らは君をそねんでいる
They are envious of you.
君の成功をそねんでいる
They are jealous of your success.
そねんであんなことを言うのだ
They say such things out of envy.
彼は同僚にそねまれた
He became an object of envy to his colleagues.
喬木風にそねまる
“Envy strikes high”―Merit is envied―“Envi will merit as a shade pursue.”
そねめそねめ
“He who wins may laugh.”

content:
その〔其〕
〈形〉That(複数―those); that same; the; his, her, its(複数―their)

content.content: その日は行かなかった
I did not go (on) that day.
その日に限って外出しなかった
I kept indoors on that particular day.
その翌日立った
I started (the) next day―the following day.
その志は感心だ
His intention does him credit.
その人は今どこに居るか
Where is the man you speak of?
その人はどこの人だ
Who is the person in question?
いったいその伊藤というのはどこの人か
Who in the world is that same Ito?
その本は東京にあるか
Is the book you speak of to be had in Tokyo?
その金をどうしたか
What have you done with the money?
十人及第して僕もその一人だ
Ten of us have passed, myself among the rest.
彼はその一を知ってその二を知らぬ
He knows only one side of the question.

content:
そのあしで〔其足で〕
〈副〉Straight; direct; at once; on the instant

content.content: 我が家へ帰るとその足で来た
When I got home, I started on the instant.
その足で学校へ行った
I went straight to the school―I made direct for the school.

そのいきで〔其意気で〕
〈副〉In that spirit; in that manner

content:
そのう〔園生〕
〈名〉A garden

content.content: 竹の園生の御身
He is an Imperial prince―He was born in the purple.

content:
そのうえ〔其上〕
〈副〉Besides; moreover; and, what is more; and, what is better; and, what is worse; and, what makes matters worse; to make matters worse; into the bargain; to boot; over and above that

content.content: その上彼は金持ちだ
And, what is better, he is rich.
彼は学問ができてその上に授業が上手だ
He is a good scholar, and, what is still better a good teacher.
一家がこう困っていてその上に病人までできた
The family was in such distress, and, what made matters worse, one of them fell ill.
彼はまあそんなわけでその上に病気ときている
He is all that―and ill, into the bargain.
彼に払うべき金を払ったその上に礼をした
I gave him something over and above what was due to him.

content:
そのうち〔其中〕
〈副〉Of the number; among the rest

content.content: 僕はそのうちに入っていない
I am not of the number.
君もそのうちだ
You are (one) of the number―one of them.
十人及第して僕もそのうちの一人です
Ten have passed, myself among the rest.
大使もそのうちに見えた
The ambassador was among those present.

content:
そのうちに〔其中に〕
〈副〉Soon; before long; one of these days; in time; all in good time

content.content: そのうちに運が開けるだろう
My fortune may improve before long.
そのうちにどうかなるだろう
Things will come round in time.
そのうちに伺います
I shall call on you one of these days.
そのうちに知らして上げます
You shall know it all in good time.
またそのうちに好いこともあるだろう
You may fare better next time.
ではまたそのうちに
Good-by till we meet again!―Au revoir!

そのおり〔其折〕
〈副〉On that occasion

そのかわり〔其代り〕
〈副〉But; on the other hand

content:
そのくせ〔其癖〕
〈副〉And yet; for all that; though; nevertheless; none the less; all the same

content.content: 彼は何でも知っているようなことを言う、そのくせ何も知らない
He talks as if he know everything, and yet he knows nothing.
彼はあんな大きなことを言っているが、そのくせばかに気が小さい
He talks big like that, and he is extremely timid for all that.
彼は酒は悪いと言うが、そのくせ好きだ
He says wine is bad for the health―he likes it, though.
彼は学問が自慢だが、そのくせちっともできない
He is proud of his scholarship, nevertheless he is no scholar at all―but he is none the less a poor scholar.
彼は口では禁酒するなどと言っているが、そのくせ相変わらず飲んでいる
He talks of giving up drinking, but he keeps on drinking all the same.
また失策した、そのくせ気をつけているのだけれども
I have made another mistake, for all the care I take.

content:
そのご〔其後〕
〈副〉After that; thereafter; ever after; subsequently:(その後今まで)since (that) ; ever since:(=の) later; subsequent

content.content: その後また逢った
I met him after that.
その後三日経って逢った
I met him three days after―three days later.
彼はその後来たか
Did he come after that?―Has he been here since?
その後は逢わない
I have not met him since.
その後はずっとここに居ます
I have been here ever since.
彼はその後は達者になった
He enjoyed good health ever after―He has enjoyed good health ever since.
その後は伯(叔)父の厄介になっております
I have lived with my uncle ever since.
それはその後の出来事だ
It was a later event―a subsequent event.

content:
そのころ〔其頃〕
〈副〉Then; at that time; in those days

content.content: その頃はまだ電車が無かった
There were no electric cars in those days.
その頃の東京はなかなかこんなものではなかった
The Tokyo of those days was not nearly what it is.

content:
そのすじ〔其筋〕
〈名〉The authorities (concerned) ; the powers that be; official circles; the proper machinery:(=の) official

content.content: その筋の命により
by order (of the authorities)
その筋の許可を得て
by permission of the authorities
その筋へ問い合わせ中
We have applied to the authorities for information.
その筋と意志疎通を欠いている
There is no mutual understanding between the people and the powers that be.
その筋への情報があった
News has been received in official circles.
その筋の通知がありました
We have had official notice of the affair.
その筋へ運動してみよう
We shall put the proper machinery in motion.
これはその筋のさしがねで書いた論説らしい
It must be an inspired article.

content:
そのせつ〔其節〕
〈副〉Then; at that time; on that occasion; in that case

content.content: その節はお世話になりました
Thank you for your kindness on that occasion!
その節はお願い申します
In that case, I shall ask you to do so.

content:
そのた〔其他〕
〈代名詞〉
1. (=そのほか)the others; the rest

content.content: その他は推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.

content: 2. (=等)and others; and so forth; and so on; and the like; and such-like (things) ; and all that; and the rest of it; and what not

content.content: 地理、歴史その他の学科は熟練を要さぬ
Geography, history, and such-like branches, require no practice.

content:
そのつぎ〔其次〕
〈副〉Next; the next time:(=の) the next; the following; the ensuing

content.content: その次に来たのが佐川だ
Next came Sagawa―Sagawa was the next to come.
その次に逢った時は身なりを直しておった
The next time I met him, he had improved his appearance.

content:
そのつもりで〔其積りで〕
〈名〉For the purpose; to that end; with that intention; with that object in view

content.content: そのつもりで勉強している
I am working with that end in view.

そのとおり〔其通り〕
〈副〉Just so; even so; exactly

content:
そのとき〔其時〕
〈副〉Then; at that time; on that occasion; in that case

content.content: その時は子どもだった
I was a child at the time.
その時はお願い申します
In that ease, I shall ask you to do so.
その時の大臣は誰でもあったか
Who was the then minister?

content:
そののち〔其後〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: そのご〔其後〕

content:
そのば〔其場〕
〈名〉The spot; the occasion:(=で)then and there; on the spot

content.content: 下手人はその場でつかまった
The murderer was arrested on the spot.
その場で理由を問えばよかったに
You ought to have demanded the reason then and there.
その場はどうにか治まった
The matter was settled somehow for the occasion―for the time being.
彼は女房を叱ってその場をごまかした
He scolded his wife to save appearances.
彼はその場の目的を達すればそれでよいのだ
He only wishes to gain his end.
彼はどうかこうかその場を遁れた
He managed to effect his retreat―make good his escape.
けんかはその場限りさ
Let not the sun go down on your quarrel.
その場限りのことを言う人だから当てにはならぬ
He is not to be relied upon, for he will speak on impulse―speak on the spur of the moment.

content:
そのひ〔其日〕
〈名、副〉
1. (On) that day; the day (that) ; on the day in question

content.content: その日は帰らなかった
He did not return (on) that day.
彼は僕が着いたその日に死んだ
He died the day I arrived.
その日を送る、その日をしのぐ
to live―get one's living―gain a livelihood―make the pot boll―keep the pot boiling―keep the wolf from the door
彼はどうしてその日を送っているか
How does he live?―How does he get his living?
賃仕事をしてその日を送っている
He gets his living by doing job-work.
かながなその日を送っている
He makes a bare living―picks up a scanty livelihood.
どうかこうかその日その日を送っている
He manages to keep the pot boiling―contrives to rub through life―scratches along somehow.
月百円では一家五人がその日をしのいでいけない
A family of five can not get along on 100 yen a month.
やっとその日その日をしのいでいくだけだ
They barely manage to live on from day to day.
後に残りし妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうしてその日を送るやら
How shall they their means of living find?

content:
そのひぐらし〔其日暮し〕
〈名〉A hand-to-mouth existence:(=する) to live from hand to mouth

content.content: 貧民はその日暮らしだ
The poor live from hand to mouth―lead a hand-to-mouth existence.

content:
そのひと〔其人〕
〈名〉The man; himself

content.content: 確かにその人だ
He is certainly the man.
誰あろう王その人であった
It was the king himself―It was none other than the king―It was no less a personage than the king.
その時来た人は誰かと思えば噂の主人公その人であった
Then who should come but the very man we were talking about?
あの学校は校長その人を得ている
The principal is the right man in the right place.

content:
そのぶん〔其分〕
〈名〉What you are

content.content: その分にはしておかぬ
You shall smart for it.

content:
そのへん〔其辺〕
〈副〉Somewhere about there:(事柄なら)about that matter:(数量なら)or thereabouts

content.content: どこかその辺にありそうなものだ
It must be somewhere about there.
その辺のことは存じません
I know nothing about that matter.
価は十円かその辺だろう
It will cost ten yen or thereabouts.
(そうかと問はれて)まあその辺だろう
That's about it―That's about the size of it.
その辺でケリがつくだろう
The matter will be settled in some such way.

content:
そのほう〔其方〕
〈名〉That direction; that way

content.content: その方へはめったに行かない
I seldom go up that way―down that way.

content: 〈代名詞〉That

content.content: その方がよい
That is the better of the two―(そうした方がよいの意味なら)―That will be the better way.
その方はいっこう不得手です
That is out of my line―That is out of my beat.
その方はいっこう不案内です
I am wholly ignorant of the matter.
その方へ気を取られている
I am engrossed in the matter.

content: 〈人称代名詞〉(Judicial) you

そのほか〔其外〕
〈名〉The others; the rest:(副詞、前置詞に用いれば)besides (that) :(打消に続けば)but that; except that; beyond that:(=の) other; further; else

content.content: そのほかは知らぬ
I do not know the rest―(人なら)―I know no one else―(事なら)―I know nothing else.
そのほかにも収入があるだろう
He must have something besides (that).
そのほかには収入が無い
He has nothing but that―He has nothing else.
そのほかになにか寄越したか
Did he give you anything besides (that)?
そのほかにはなにもお寄越しになりません
He gave me nothing but that―He gave me nothing else―That was all he gave me.
そのほかに聞き込んだことは無いか
Have you heard anything besides (that)?
そのほかはなにも聞きません
I have heard nothing but that―nothing except that―nothing beyond that―nothing else.
そのほかにご用はありませんか
Have you any other orders?
そのほかに質問はありませんか
Have you any other questions to ask?
そのほかにまだ理由がある
I have further reasons for doing so.

content:
そのまま〔其儘〕
〈副〉As one is; as it is; as you find it; as it stands

content.content: そのままにしておけ
Leave it as it is―Leave it as you found it.
そのままで結構です
I like it as it is―I don't wish it otherwise.
資本を手をつけずにそのままにしておけ
Keep the capital intact.
家はこわさないでそのままにしてある
We have left the house standing―The house is still standing.
家はそのままで一万円には売れる
The house will sell for 10,000 yen as it stands.
家は倒れてそのままになっている
The house remains as it fell.
あのことはそのままにしておいた
I have left the matter as it was.
あのことはそのままになっている
The matter remains as it was―And there the matter rests.
このことはそのままにしておかれぬ
We must not leave the matter as it is―The matter must not rest here―We must look to the matter.
そのままそこに居れ
Stay where you are!
事実をそのまま述べます
I will state the facts as they are.
どうぞそのまま
(立つことは無いの意味なら)Please keep seated!―Please keep your seat!―(送り出す人を止めてなら)―Not a step!―Not a step farther!
そのまま立っておれ
Keep standing!
外套を脱ぐことはないそのまま着ておいで
Keep your overcoat on!
靴をそのままはいておれ
Keep your shoes on!
窓を(締めずに)そのまま開けておけ
Keep the window open!―Leave the window open!
ランプを消さずにそのままつけておけ
Keep the lamp burning!―Leave the lamp burning!
電灯をそのままつけておけ
Keep the electric light on!
見て来たことをそのまま話そう
I will tell you what I saw.
聞いた話をそのまま話そう
I will tell you what I heard―tell the story as I heard it.
彼は親父そっくりそのままだ
He is the very image of his father―the very picture of his father―the very moral of his father―He is his father all over―He is a chip of the old block.
彼の目鼻立ちはお母さんそっくりそのままだ
His features are his mother's to a hair―to a tittle.
彼の文章は先生そのままだ
His style is an exact copy of his teacher's.

content: 〈接続詞〉As soon as; no sooner... than... ; scarcely... when...

content.content: 枕をつけるとそのまま眠る
I fall asleep as soon as I lie down―I no sooner lie down than I fall asleep―I scarcely lie down when I fall asleep.
来るとそのままつまみ食い
She no sooner comes in than she begins eating with her fingers.

content:
そのみち〔其道〕
〈名〉The line of business; the art; the subject; the trade; the profession; the specialty

content.content: その道に明るい
He is in the line―in the trade―in the business―versed in the subject.
その道に暗からず
He is versed in the subject―skilled in the art.
その道を極める
to master one's business―make oneself master of one's profession
彼はその道を極めている
He is master of his business.
その道の為に尽くす
to devote oneself to one's art
その道の人
a specialist―a professional―an expert
その道の人に聞いてみた
I have consulted a specialist.
その道の大家だ
He is an authority on the subject―a master of his business.
その道の達人だ
He is an adept in the art―a master of his art.
その道の連中
(men of) the fancy

content:
そのむき〔其向き〕
〈名〉That quarter:(関係者の意味なら)the persons concerned:(当局者の意味なら)the authorities concerned

content.content: その向きに運動している
I am making interest in the proper quarter―putting the proper machinery in motion.
その向きへ問い合わせ中です
I have applied to the authorities for information.

content:
そのむね〔其旨〕
〈名〉That effect

content.content: 当日出席することあたわざる者はその旨届け出るべし
Those who can not attend on the day shall report to that effect.
その旨言ってやりました
I have written to him to that effect.

content:
そのもの〔其物〕
〈名〉The thing; itself

content.content: 炭酸ガスそのものは毒ではない
Carbonic acid gas is not a poison in itself.
彼は勉強そのものを愛す
He loves labour for its own sake―loves labour for labour's sake.
戦争そのものを愛して戦争をしたのは Alexander and Charles Ⅰ2
Alexander and Charles Ⅰ2 waged war for war's sake.
徳そのものを愛して行わなければ真の徳ではない
We must practise virtue for virtue's sake.
計画そのものには反対しないがその根本の主義を攻撃するのだ
I do not oppose the scheme as such, but attack the underlying principle.

content:
そのような〔其様な〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: そんな

content:
そのように〔其様に〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: そんなに

そは〔粗葉〕
〈名〉Coarse tobacco (so called in depreciation)

content:
そば〔蕎麦〕
〈名〉Buckwheat:(蕎麦切りは)buckwheat vermicelli

content.content: 蕎麦を打つ
to make buckwheat vermicelli
蕎麦を一杯ご馳走になった
I was treated to a dish of buckwheat vermicelli.
蕎麦屋
a buckwheat shop
蕎麦粉
buckwheat flour
蕎麦掻き
buckwheat mash
蕎麦饅頭
a buckwheat bun
蕎麦殻
buckwheat chaff

content:
そば〔側〕
〈名〉Side; neighbourhood; vicinity:(=に) beside (something); by (something); about (one); near by, close by, hard by (a place); alongside (a ship)

content.content: そばに座れ
Sit by me!
そばに立て
Stand beside me!
そばに立っている者は親でも使え
Whoever comes handy will be ordered about.
門番小屋は門のそばにある
The lodge stands by the gate.
端艇は本船のそばにある
The boat is lying alongside the ship.
彼の家はじきそばだ
He lives near by―close by―hard by.
学校のじきそばに宿を取りました
I have taken up my quarters close by the school―near by the school―hard by the school.
彼は僕のそばへ寄った
He was at my side.
もっとそばへお寄りなさい
Draw nearer!
もっとそばへ寄ってご覧なさい
Take a near view of the article!
そばへ寄るな
Stand off!
僕などはとても彼のそばにも寄れない
I am no match for him―I am not a patch upon him―I can not hold a candle to him.
この子をそばへ置いて行儀を教えてやりましょう
I will keep her about me, and teach her how to behave.
この子は行儀を知らないからとてもそばに置けない
She is so ill-bred that there is no bearing her about one.
あの子をそばに置きたいのです
I want her about me.
その子をそばへ呼んで優しい言葉をかけてやった
I called her to my side, and spoke kindly to her.
おそばに仕える
to attend on my lord
おそばに居たいのです
I wish to live with you.
早く年明け主{ぬし}のそば
How I long for my term to expire, that I may live with you!
おそばに居たいと辛抱してこれまで居たのがお身の仇
From a desire to live with you, I have thus stayed on to your ruin.
できるとそばからそばから食ってしまう
They are eaten up as soon as they are made―as fast as they are made.
掃除するとそばからそばから散らかす
The room is no sooner swept than it is littered.
積み上げるとそばからそばから崩れる
They come down as fast as they are piled up.
彼の嘘はそばからはげる
His lies are thin―transparent.

そはい〔鼠輩〕
〈名〉Small fry; nobodies; nullities; nonentities; ciphers

content:
そばえる
〈他動〉→『

content.content: あまえる〔甘える〕

そばがき〔蕎麦掻き〕
〈名〉Buckwheat mash

content:
そばかす〔雀斑〕
〈名〉Freckles

content.content: あの女は雀斑がある
She has a freckled face.

content:
そばだつ〔峙つ〕
〈自動〉To tower; to soar; to rise

content.content: 山頂は雲上にそばだつ
The summit rises above the clouds―soars above clouds―towers above the clouds.
山岳四隣を圧してそばだつ
The mountains lord it over―dominate over―the surrounding country.

content:
そばだてる〔欹てる〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 耳をそばだてる
to prick up one's ears―cock one's ears―strain one's ears
耳をそばだてて聞く
to listen
人が僕の話をしているから耳をそばだてて聞いた
As they were talking about me, I strained my ears and listened―I listened with strained ears―I was all ears.
利益の話をすると皆耳をそばだてて聞く
When one talks of advantages, everybody pricks up his ears.
目をそばだてる
to gaze―stand at gaze
人の目をそばだてさせる
to set people at gaze―attract the attention of people
英国では人がどんな変なことをしても目をそばだてる者が無い
However whimsical a thing a man may do in England, he attracts nobody's attention.

content:
そばづえ〔側杖〕
〈名〉A side-stroke; a by-blow

content.content: けんかの側杖を食う
to get a by-blow in another's quarrel―(より)―to be involved in a quarrel―embroiled in a quarrel

そばづかえ〔側仕え〕
〈名〉(男は)a valet; a valet-de-chambre:(女は)a lady's maid

content:
そばめる〔側める〕
〈他動〉To lean; to incline

content.content: 目をそばめる
to glare at one―look daggers at one
夫婦目をそばめる
Man and wife are at war with each other.

content:
そはん〔粗飯〕
〈名〉A plain dinner, a poor dinner (so called in depreciation)

content.content: 粗飯をさし上げたい
Will you favour me with your company at dinner?

content:
そびえる〔聳える〕
〈自動〉To rise; to tower; to soar

content.content: 富士の高嶺は東京の西に当たってそびえる
The heights of Fuji rise to the west of Tokyo.
山は雲にそびえる
The mountain soars to the sky.
山頂は雲上にそびえる
The summit rises above the clouds―towers above the clouds―soars above the clouds.
山岳四隣を圧してそびゆ
The mountains lord it over―dominate over―the surrounding country.
高峯天を靡{び}してそびゆ
The peak kisses the welkin.
一棟巍然{ぎぜん}として隣家を凌ぎそびゆ
A single edifice towers above the neighbouring houses.
眼前にそびゆるは天守閣なり
Before you stands the castle-tower.

content:
そひん〔粗品〕
〈名〉A coarse article, a trifle (so called in depreciation)

content.content: 粗品乍ら御受納被下度候
I beg you will accept a trifling present.

content:
そふく〔粗服〕
〈名〉Plain dress; poor clothes; shabby clothes

content.content: 彼は至って粗服を着ている
He is plainly dressed―poorly clad―in shabby clothes.

content:
そぶり〔素振り〕
〈名〉(One's) air, look, manner, behaviour

content.content: どんなそぶりをする
to behave (how?)―show something by one's look and manner
惚れたのはそぶりでわかる
Love betrays itself in one's look and manner.
女が男に惚れたようなそぶりをした
She behaved towards him as if she loved him―She showed her love for him by her look and manner.
彼女は惚れていることをそぶりにも見せない
She does not betray her love in her look or manner.
あの男はそぶりが変だ、君は気がつかないか
His behaviour is strange―Don't you notice his strange behaviour?

content:
そほう〔粗放〕
〈形〉Careless; imprudent

content.content: 性粗放
He is careless by nature―of a careless disposition.→『そほうのうほう〔粗放農法〕』

content:
そぼう〔粗暴〕
〈形〉Rude (manner); rough (speech); gruff (tone, etc.)

content.content: 軍人は言語動作が粗暴だ
Soldiers are rough of speech and rude of manner.
粗暴な振る舞いをするな
Don't be rude to people!
彼は活発過ぎて粗暴に流れる
He is active to rudeness.

そぼう〔素望〕
〈名〉One's cherished hope; one's cherished desire

そほうか〔素封家〕
〈名〉A wealthy man; a man of wealth

そほうのうほう〔粗放農法〕
〈名〉Extensive agriculture; the extensive method

content:
そぼく〔素朴〕
〈形〉Simple; simple-hearted; simple-minded; simple and honest

content.content: 素朴な人だ
He is a simple-hearted man.
素朴な村民
the simple villagers
村民は素朴な美風を存している
The villagers retain their primitive simplicity.
交通不便の地ほど人気が素朴だ
The more secluded a place, the simpler are the people.

content:
そぼふる
〈自動〉It drizzles; it mizzles

content.content: そぼふる雨
a drizzling rain―a drizzle―a mizzle

そほん〔粗笨〕
〈形〉Coarse; rude; crude

そま〔杣〕
〈名〉A wood-cutter; a woodman; a lumberman

content:
そまつ〔粗末〕
〈形〉Coarse (tea) ; rude (cabin) ; crude (work) ; plain (food or dress) ; poor (fare) ; inferior (article) ; sorry, wretched (stuff) ; careless, slighting (treatment) ; rough (usage or handling) :(=にする) to be careless of (one's health) ; to slight (a man) ; to neglect (the gods) ; to waste (good meat) ; to fudge, scamp (one's work) :(=にせぬ) to be careful of (one's health) ; to take good care of (anything) ; to treat, use, handle (anything) with care

content.content: 粗末な品
a coarse article―a poor article―an inferior article
粗末な物ですがどうぞお納め下さい
Please accept it, though it is scarcely worthy of your acceptance.
粗末な食物
plain food―poor fare
粗末な食物がかえって滋養が有る
The plainest food is often the most nourishing.
粗末な物ですがどうぞ召し上がって下さい
You must put up with poor fare.
粗末な衣服
plain dress―poor clothes
彼は粗末な身なりをしている
He is plainly dressed.
粗末な家
a roughly-built house―a rude cabin
粗末な茶
coarse tea―poor tea―inferior tea
粗末な作
a crude work―a poor work―sorry stuff―wretched stuff
近頃本がよく出るがお粗末なものが多い
Many books come out, but most of them are sorry stuff―wretched stuff.
お粗末な学者だ
He is a poor scholar.
粗末な取扱い
careless treatment―slighting treatment―rough handling
この時計は丈夫だから粗末に持ってもこわれない
This watch is a strong one, and will stand rough handling.
人を粗末に取扱う
to treat a man slightingly―put a slight on a man―slight a man―neglect a man
どうもお粗末でした
I am afraid you will feel yourself slighted―You will think me wanting in courtesy―I am sorry I have done nothing to entertain you.
身体を粗末にする
to be careless of one's health
身体を粗末にするな
Be careful of your health!
金銭を粗末にする
to be careless of one's money
金銭を粗末にするな
Be careful of your money!
親を粗末にするな
Do not neglect your parents!
神様を粗末にするな
Do not neglect the gods!
食物を粗末にするな
Do not waste good meat!
仕事を粗末にするな
Do not slight your work!―Do not fudge your work!―Do not scamp your work!
事の何たるかを問わず粗末にするな
Be the matter what it may, do your best!
お粗末ながら進呈しよう
You shall have it, such as it is.
僕もお粗末ながらフロックコートをもっている
I boast a frock-coat, such as it is.

content:
そまびと〔杣人〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: そま〔杣〕

そまやま〔杣山〕
〈名〉Woods; a wooded mountain; timbered land

content:
そまる〔染まる〕
〈自動〉
1. To dye; to be dyed

content.content: この絹はよく染まる、よく染まらぬ
This silk dyes well―dyes badly.
血に染まる
to be dyed with blood
朱{あけ}に染まる
to be dyed crimson
血が流れて着物が朱に染まった
The blood flowing dyed his clothes crimson.

content: 2. (=悪風などに染まる)to be stained (with vice) ; to be tainted (with vice) ; to be infected (with vice) ; to be steeped (in vice) ; to fall (into evil ways)

content.content: あの若い書生は悪に染まっている
The young student is steeped in vice.
悪には染まりやすい
One is easily tainted with vice.
あの女は花柳界の悪風に染まっている
She is tainted with the impurity of the demi-monde―steeped in the vices of the frivolous community.
花柳界の悪風に染まった女は良妻賢母にはなれぬ
A woman infected with the impurity of the frivolous community can not make a good wife or mother.
彼は時俗に染まず
He does no conform to the age.

content:
そみ〔粗密〕
〈名〉Density (and rarity or sparseness)

content.content: 人口の粗密
the density of population

content:
そむ〔染む〕
〈自他動〉→『

content.content: そまる〔染まる〕
そめる〔染める〕

content:
そむく〔背く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=背反する)to be contrary to (reason) ; to be against (rule) ; to go against (one's principles) ; to act against (one's wishes) ; to sin against (morality) ; to fly in the face of (experience) ; to belie (one's character) ; to betray (one's confidence) ; to disobey (orders)

content.content: それは道理に背く
It is against reason―contrary to reason.
法律に背いている
It is against law―contrary to the laws.
法律に背く行動だ
It is an unlawful action.
規則に背いている
It is against rule―against all rule.
そんなことをしては校則に背く
That would be against the school regulations.
先例に背く
It is contrary to precedent―against all precedent.
それは道徳に背く
It is contrary to the laws of morality―You sin against morality.
それは道徳に背く行動だ
It is an immoral action.
人道に背く
It is against the laws of humanity.
人道に背く行動だ
It is an inhuman action.
おまえは命令に背いた
You have acted against my orders―acted contrary to orders―disobeyed orders.
人の意に背く
to act against one's wishes
彼は親の意に背いて船乗りになった
He went to sea against his father's wishes.
この金を取っては主義に背きます
It would go against my principles to take this money.
そんなことをしては良心に背く
It would go against my conscience to do such a thing.
さすがの暴利屋もそう貪っては良心に背くだろう
He can not charge so much with a good conscience―He can not, in conscience, charge so much.
人情には背かれぬ
You can not go against human nature―You can not outrage nature.
自然の法則には背かれぬ
Nature will be obeyed.
そんなことをしては世の習慣に背く
That would be against custom―You would sin against custom.
礼儀に背く
to sin against propriety
美術の法に背く
to sin against the canon of taste
名に背く
to belie one's name
東洋の英国はその名に背かず
The England of the East is true to her name―The England of the East justifies her name.
彼の容貌は人格に背かぬ(看板に偽り無し)
His looks do not belie his character.
結果は期待に背く
The result is contrary to expectation―The result belies my expectations―The result is disappointing.
(殴られるつもりで来たのか)それでは期待に背くまい(殴ってやろう)
Then I will not disappoint you.
僕の信任に背くな
You must not betray my confidence―You must justify my confidence (in you).
誓ってご信任に背きません
I will not betray your confidence―betray your trust.
そんなことを期待しては経験に背く
Your expectations fly in the face of experience.

content: 2. (=犯す、破る)to break, violate, infringe, transgress, contravene, offend against, trespass against (the law) ; to break, commit a breach of (promise)

content.content: 僕は知らずして法律に背いたのであった
I had broken the law―violated the law―offended against the law―without knowing it.
憲法に背いたことをする
to infringe the constitution―contravene the constitution
文法の規則に背く
to violate the rules of grammar―break Priscian's head
規則に背いたことをする
to break a rule―violate a rule
この規則に背くと十円の罰金だ
The violation of this rule is punishable with a fine of 10 yen.
彼は約に背いた
He has broken his promise―committed a breach of promise.
言に背く
to break one's word―go back on one's word
彼はその言に背かず
He kept his word―He was true to his word―He was as good as his word.

content: 3. (=謀叛する)to rebel against, revolt against, rise against, rise in arms against (the government) ; to betray, turn traitor to, be false to (one's cause) ; to fall away from allegiance ; to fall off

content.content: 政府に背く
to rebel against the government―revolt against the government―rise (in arms) against the government
君に背く
to rebel against one's lord―fall from allegiance
属国の中にはこの混雑に乗じて背いたものがある
Some of the subject states benefited by the confusion and fell from allegiance―fell off.
党員の中に背いた者は無いか
Have any of the members betrayed the cause?―turned traitor to their cause?
一人も背いた者は無い
Not one of them was false to his party―They were all true to their party.

content:
そむける〔背ける〕
〈他動〉To turn away; to avert

content.content: 目をそむける
to avert one's eyes―turn away one's eyes―look away―look the other way
顔をそむける
to avert one's face―turn away one's face―look away―look the other away
彼女は恥かしがって顔をそむけた
She bashfully averted her face.
彼は顔をそむけて僕を見ないふりをした
He looked away―looked the other way―and took no notice of me.

content:
そめ〔染め〕
〈名〉Dyeing; colour

content.content: この反物は染めが好い
This cloth is well dyed.
この染めは洗いが利くか
Does this colour wash?
染薬、染粉
a dye―dye-stuff

そめかえし〔染め返し〕
〈名〉Redyeing

そめかえす〔染め返す〕
〈他動〉To redye; to dye again
